title: Interdisciplinary
description:
Announcement Type

TARP - Direct-Hire Authority (DHA)

Position Type

Permanent

USACE Organization

Institute for Water Resources (IWR)

Locations (City, State)

Davis, CA

Position Overview/Duties

Position: Interdisciplinary GS-1550/1530/1520/0110/0810-14

Introduction: The incumbent will serve within the Hydrologic Engineering Center (HEC) Water Resources Systems (WRS) Division as the lead developer of the Hydrologic Engineering Centerâ€™s Flood Damage Reduction Analysis (HEC-FDA) software program, a mission-critical state-of-the-art Army-wide water resources software application used for flood risk assessment with uncertainty. The incumbent serves as a technical leader for a small team in the research, development, testing, distribution, maintenance, and improvement of the software. The incumbent must demonstrate mastery in computational statistics, flood consequences, and flood risk assessment modeling, as well as in computer science techniques, procedures, and processes including operating system theory, data structures, computer system architecture, software engineering principles, common object-oriented programming languages (preferably C#), computer communications protocols, build systems, and version control systems. The incumbent will lead an internal team in the application of these computer science requirements for modeling flood risk; outsourcing is not an acceptable path for development of HEC-FDA.

PERIOD OF ASSIGNMENT: PERMANENT

Description Of Assignment/Duties
â€¢ Maintain deep technical understanding of all assigned software codebases and related systems and ensure their long-term stability, theoretical consistency, and technical qualityâ€”including computational engines, user interfaces, databases, build and version-control tools, testing infrastructure, and distribution systems. Maintain active certification of the assigned software applications for use on USACE Planning Studies in collaboration with the Flood Risk Management Planning Center of Expertise (FRM-PCX) in accordance to Engineering Circular 1105-2-412, Assuring Quality of Planning Models, dated 31 March 2011. Develop and maintain a highly robust software testing and validation plans which involve automated computational unit and benchmark testing in support of efficient certification of new versions of the software applications. Understand and implement advanced troubleshooting techniques for modern multiplatform software to identify and resolve correctness and performance issues.
â€¢ Develop all project management and project planning requirements in support of software development, including design documents, work breakdown structures, cost estimates, work allocation/resourcing plans, and completion schedules. Track planned codebase enhancements and routine codebase maintenance using standard software development project management tools, such as GitHub or Jira. In collaboration with the HEC-FDA program manager, set clear goals and priorities; communicate plans in terms of actionable requirements; ensure the team can deliver high-quality software updates through effective communication, processes, architectural/technical guidance, and removal of blockers; evaluate resource requirements and allocate work. Assist and advise software development team to align project plans and development progress with the software design requirements. Mentor staff in software development, identify training requirements, and work with supervisor to effectuate training.
â€¢ Lead effort to resource and fund new software development or maintenance. Identify emerging requirements for software applications, including new or improved capability, resolution of bugs, consolidation of software, or reduction of technical debt. Engage with customers, SMEs, and stakeholders for proper design implementation of new software features. Collaborate with HEC-FDA program manager on technology transition requirements and to ensure development and maintenance is aligned with program strategic plan. Responsible for leading, drafting, and submitting funding proposals for software development. Advocate for software development funding and defends development efforts at Research and Development progress review meetings.
â€¢ Provide leadership, expert technical direction, consultation, and guidance to national software development teams relating to computational statistics software design and risk assessment modeling best practices. Coordinate with technical specialists (internal and external to the agency) for research and development of computational statistics and risk assessment software and modeling. Partner with other agencies and academia regarding computational statistics and risk assessment software development and enhancements. Stay abreast of state-of-the-art technology relating to computer software systems and risk assessment methodology to lead, mentor, and implement new technologies and modeling techniques. Serving as a national leader and source of expertise in computational statistics and risk assessment modeling and software development. Maintaining up to date knowledge of current and cutting-edge software design principles, programming languages, software development systems, testing procedures, and distribution software/procedures.

Other Conditions And Requirements
â€¢ APPLICABILITY/AREA OF CONSIDERATION: This is a Direct Hire Authority (DHA) solicitation utilizing the DHA for Certain Personnel of the DoD, Section 9905 to recruit and appoint qualified candidates to positions in the competitive service.
â€¢ WHO MAY APPLY: US Citizens
â€¢ APPLICANT QUALIFICATIONS:
â€¢ Basic Requirement (Note: You must attach a copy of your transcripts.):

ï‚§ GS-1550-14 can be found at https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-standards/1500/computer-science-series-1550/

ï‚§ GS-1530-14 can be found at https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-standards/1500/statistics-series-1530/

ï‚§ GS-1520-14 can be found at https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-standards/1500/mathematics-series-1520/

ï‚§ GS-0110-14 can be found at https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-standards/0100/economist-series-0110/

ï‚§ GS-0810-14 can be found at extension://efaidnbmnnnibpcajpcglclefindmkaj/https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-standards/0800/files/all-professional-engineering-positions-0800.pdf
â€¢ In addition to meeting the basic requirement above, to qualify for this position you must also meet the qualiï¬cation requirement listed below:
â€¢ Experience Requirement: I have one year of specialized experience equivalent to at least the GS-13 grade level in the Federal service which includes: Leading the full cycle from research to testing/improvement of engineering software applications including computational engines, user interfaces, databases, and/or testing infrastructure; leading a team of software developers including allocating work, needs determination for contracting services, and assuring team adheres to software design requirements' mentoring subordinate staff in software development and identifying training needs; performing applied research in computational statistics and flood risk assessment; Planning and leading development of technical documentation in support of technology transition including codebase documentation, technical reference manuals, and user guides. This definition of specialized experience is typical of work performed at the next lower grade/level position in the federal service (GS-13). Some federal jobs allow you to substitute your education for the required experience to qualify. For this job, you must meet the qualification requirement using experience alone--no substitution of education for experience is permitted.

Competencies Needed For The Position
â€¢ Network Design, Development, and Management
â€¢ Leadership
â€¢ Research and Data Analysis
â€¢ Oral Communication
â€¢ Software Development

Conditions Of Employment
â€¢ One-year probationary period may be required.
â€¢ One-year supervisory probationary period may be required.
â€¢ This position has a Temporary Duty (TDY) or business travel requirement of 25% of the time.
â€¢ Appointment may be subject to suitability or fitness determination, as determined by a completed background investigation. Position is designated as Non-Sensitive-No access security clearance.

Other Requirements
â€¢ Selection is subject to restrictions resulting from Department of Defense referral system for displaced employees.
â€¢ You will be required to provide proof of U.S. Citizenship.
â€¢ This position is Exempt from the Fair Labor Standards Act .
â€¢ Nepotism: Under the provisions of 5 USC 3110, an individual may not be appointed into a position if the position is under the supervisory chain of command of a relative.
â€¢ This announcement may be used to fill like vacancies for three months after the closing date.
â€¢ This position MAY be eligible for situational telework only, including emergency and OPM prescribed "Unscheduled Telework".
â€¢ All qualifications requirements must be met by the closing date of this announcement.
â€¢ Salary includes applicable locality pay or Local Market Supplement.
â€¢ Direct deposit of pay is required.
â€¢ This is a(n) CP-18-Construction, Engineering, Infrastructure Career Field position .
â€¢ Payment of Permanent Change of Station (PCS) costs IS NOT authorized.
â€¢ Relocation/Recruitment Incentives may be authorized (up to 25%).
â€¢ Male applicants born after December 31, 1959, are required to register for Selective Service prior to appointment.
â€¢ Applications must be submitted after 12:01 AM (EST) of the posted Job Posting Open Date and before 11:59 PM (EST) of the posted Job Posting Close Date to receive consideration.
â€¢ Point of contact for this announcement is Kim Core.

Your Resume
â€¢ Your resume must be two pages or less and must support the specialized experience described in this announcement. Resumes exceeding two pages will be removed from consideration.
â€¢ For each relevant work experience, make sure you include the employer's name, job title, start and end dates (include month and year), for qualifications purposes, the number of hours worked per week, and a brief description that show you can perform the tasks at the required level listed in the job announcement. If your resume does not contain this information, your application may be marked as incomplete, and you may not receive consideration for this position.
â€¢ Use plain language. Avoid using acronyms and terms that are not easily understood. The hiring agency will not make assumptions about what's in your resume.
â€¢ If your resume includes a photograph or other inappropriate material or content, it will not be used to make eligibility and qualification determinations, and you may not be considered for this vacancy.

Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Policy: The United States government does not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, military service or other non-merit factor

To learn more, please visit the Office of Equal Opportunity (https://www.eeoc.gov/federal-sector/federal-employees-job-applicants).

Qualifications

Candidates will be evaluated IAW OPM Requirements: https://www.opm.gov/policy-data-oversight/classification-qualifications/general-schedule-qualification-standards/

Reasonable Accommodation

Reasonable accommodation is available to qualified employees with disabilities. You can request a reasonable accommodation at any time during the application process, hiring process or while on the job. Requests are evaluated on a case-by-case basis.

title: Software Engineer: Frontend
description:
Observe is a SaaS Observability tool that enables Engineering and DevOps teams to troubleshoot modern distributed applications 10x faster. Observe ingests machine-generated data and turns it into a graph of things that are understandable by humans. We enable engineers to spend more time coding features and less time investigating incidents. Because of Observeâ€™s unique elastic architecture, our product is priced based on usage, making it cost 10x less than incumbents. Watch this video to learn more about our mission.

Observe was founded by top enterprise VC Sutter Hill Ventures and has a founding team from leading Enterprise SaaS companies Snowflake, Splunk, and Wavefront. Weâ€™re excited to grow our front-end engineering team. You will be spending your time working and learning from some of the best as we deliver a delightful UI that is both simple to use and powerful enough for experts to troubleshoot complex applications. View our demo.

As a Frontend Engineer, You Will
â€¢ Develop an interactive, data-rich user interface using React, Typescript, D3, SASS/SCSS, etc.
â€¢ Own the end-to-end delivery of substantial product features.
â€¢ Work closely with product managers, UX designers, backend engineers to develop new features
â€¢ Be a strong contributor to the product vision and team planning
â€¢ Be a part of a rapidly growing startup with a strong VC backing

What We Are Looking For
â€¢ Experience building/maintaining complex enterprise applications
â€¢ Day-to-day knowledge of modern web technologies like React, Javascript, Typescript, D3, etc.
â€¢ A sophisticated understanding of how to use interfaces and design patterns to create simple and reusable components for a complex, technical UI
â€¢ Confidently can make the right trade-offs between functionality and delivery speed so that we deliver both value and wow-factor to customers
â€¢ Passion for front-end development, and the impacts it has on overall customer experience.
â€¢ Growth mindset, willingness to using every opportunity to learn, discover and grow
â€¢ Open to all levels!

What We Like
â€¢ We arenâ€™t interested in asking about computer science fundamentals you learned in college years ago, we care more about finding people who can apply their practical experience to get things done
â€¢ Experience with commercial dashboarding and analytics products (e.g. Splunk, Datadog, Looker, Power BI) is preferable
â€¢ Knowledge of the core building blocks in web browsers, like the DOM, CSS, Canvas, XHR, etc.
â€¢ Startup or growth-stage experience is also preferable

About Us

Observe's mission is to turn business data into information. Our SaaS Observability product ingests anything with a timestamp - logs, metrics, traces - and then curates and relates that data to provide unique insights into a customerâ€™s data universe. If a customer has a problem on the application layer, engineering teams can seamlessly find the root cause of the issue whether thatâ€™s a new release pushed to production from Jenkins, or an underlying database or memory issue. We enable engineers to spend more time coding features and less time investigating incidents. We reduce outages and issues with customer experience. And we leverage an elastic cloud architecture so that customers only pay for what they use. To learn more about Observe, visit www.observeinc.com or join the conversation on Twitter @Observe_Inc.

Observe Inc. is a diversity-friendly zone. We seek to assemble a heterogeneous team where employees from all backgrounds can feel valued, appreciated, and celebrated, and where individual development does not come second to our collective goals.

title: Software Engineer / Agentic AI / LangChain
description:

title: Software Engineer - ServiceNow and Angular and Java
description:

Responsible at the proficient level for writing code and the teams' technical requirements gathering. Completes work following banking technology standards and contributes to the overall stability and resiliency of banking technology within the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC).

Supervisory/Managerial Responsibilities:

No supervisory responsibilities.

Job Description:

"Job Description: Validation Engineer (AI-Driven Test & Validation)

Job Title - Validation Engineer â€“ AI-Driven Testing & Validation

Role Summary

We are seeking a Validation Engineer with an innovative mindset to modernize how we test and validate neuromodulation software applications (e.g., clinician tools, patient apps, therapy management applications, device companion software). This role will apply AI/ML and intelligent automation techniques to transform the test and validation lifecycleâ€”improving speed, coverage, traceability, and defect prevention while meeting medical device quality and regulatory expectations.

This is an ideal role for someone who is fluent in V&V rigor and also excited about rethinking testing using AI-assisted approaches such as test generation, risk-based prioritization, log anomaly detection, intelligent regression selection, requirements-to-test mapping, and documentation automation.

Key Responsibilities

â€¢ Modernize the Testing & Validation Paradigm Using AI
â€¢ Design and implement AI-assisted testing approaches to improve effectiveness and reduce cycle time, such as:
â€¢ Intelligent test case generation from requirements, hazards, and user workflows
â€¢ AI-based regression test prioritization and selection
â€¢ Automated exploratory testing support (session-based + AI insights)
â€¢ Defect clustering and root-cause hints from telemetry/logs
â€¢ AI-assisted test review and gap analysis
â€¢ Identify high-value opportunities to replace manual, repetitive testing with automation + intelligent decisioning while maintaining compliance.
â€¢ Verification & Validation for Neuromodulation Applications
â€¢ Own and execute verification and validation (V&V) for software applications supporting neuromodulation therapy workflows.
â€¢ Develop risk-based test strategies across unit, integration, system, and release validation.
â€¢ Validate end-to-end workflows such as:
â€¢ Therapy setup/configuration support
â€¢ Patient/clinician workflows and UI behaviors
â€¢ Data handling, storage, sync, and reporting
â€¢ Connectivity scenarios (pairing, reconnects, dropped links, offline mode)
â€¢ Error handling, alarms/notifications, and safe behaviors
â€¢ Automation & Test Infrastructure
â€¢ Build and maintain automated test frameworks for web/mobile/desktop applications (as applicable), including:
â€¢ UI automation, API/integration tests, and service virtualization
â€¢ Test data generation and environment management
â€¢ CI/CD integration with quality gates and automated reporting
â€¢ Establish repeatable, auditable test execution pipelines and improve test reliability (flakiness reduction, stable test environments).
â€¢ Risk Management & Safety-Driven Validation
â€¢ Translate hazard analysis outputs (e.g., FMEA, hazard tables) into explicit, testable safety requirements and verification evidence.
â€¢ Ensure validation covers:
â€¢ Safety constraints and guardrails
â€¢ â€œMisuseâ€ and human error scenarios
â€¢ Boundary conditions, stress and performance scenarios
â€¢ Fail-safe behavior and clear user messaging
â€¢ Traceability, Documentation, and Audit Readiness
â€¢ Produce and maintain V&V deliverables suitable for a regulated environment:
â€¢ Test plans, protocols, reports, and objective evidence
â€¢ Requirements Traceability Matrix (RTM) and coverage reporting
â€¢ Defect documentation with severity rationale and verification of fixes
â€¢ Use AI to accelerate documentation while ensuring correctness, reviewability, and compliance (e.g., structured templates, auto-linking evidence).
â€¢ Cross-Functional Leadership & Change Enablement
â€¢ Partner with Software, Systems, Quality, Regulatory, Human Factors, and Clinical stakeholders.
â€¢ Champion continuous improvement: propose new approaches, run pilots, and scale successful innovations across programs.
â€¢ Develop internal guidance, playbooks, and training to help the organization adopt AI-driven validation methods safely and responsibly.

Required Qualifications

â€¢ Bachelorâ€™s deg"

title: Slalom Flex (Project Based) â€“ Technical Engineer (Pega)
description:
Role: Slalom Flex (Project Based) â€“ Technical Engineer (Pega)

Location: Remote supporting EST working hours

Who Youâ€™ll Work With

Our teams help organizations of all kinds redefine whatâ€™s possible, give shape to the future â€“ and get there. We focus on high-impact projects, meeting our clients where they are to uncover business needs and deliver results. Our teams go beyond the expected to help clients move confidently through ambiguity and risk and drive more transformative outcomes.

The Technical Engineer with strong Pega expertise will focus on designing, building, and optimizing enterprise workflows on the Pega Platform, ensuring high performance, security, and scalability.

What Youâ€™ll Do

â€¢ Design and Build: Develop case types, flows, UI rules, and data models on Pega Platform (v7.x / v8.x).
â€¢ Integrations: Implement and troubleshoot integrations (REST, SOAP, APIs, MQ, databases).
â€¢ Performance & Security: Conduct performance tuning and enforce security/access control best practices.
â€¢ Collaboration: Work within Agile/Scrum teams, partnering with business analysts, QA, and DevOps.
â€¢ Consulting Excellence: Translate business requirements into technical solutions and provide clear recommendations to stakeholders.

What Youâ€™ll Bring

â€¢ Strong expertise in Pega Platform (v7.x / v8.x).
â€¢ Proven experience as a Technical or Lead Pega Architect on large-scale implementations.
â€¢ Deep understanding of:
â€¢ Case Management, Flows, and UI rules
â€¢ Data modeling and decisioning
â€¢ Pega performance tuning and optimization
â€¢ Security and access control

â€¢ Hands-on experience with integrations (REST, SOAP, APIs, MQ, databases).
â€¢ Experience with Agile/Scrum methodologies.
â€¢ Experience with Pega migrations and upgrades.
â€¢ Pega certifications such as:
â€¢ Pega Certified Lead System Architect (CLSA)
â€¢ Pega Certified Senior System Architect (CSSA)

â€¢ Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP).
â€¢ Exposure to DevOps tools and CI/CD pipelines.
â€¢ Experience in regulated industries (Financial Services, Healthcare, Insurance).
â€¢ Consulting experience.

About Us

Slalom is a fiercely human business and technology consulting company that leads with outcomes to bring more value, in all ways, always. From strategy through delivery, our agile teams across 52 offices in 12 countries collaborate with clients to bring powerful customer experiences, innovative ways of working, and new products and services to life. We are trusted by leaders across the Global 1000, many successful enterprise and mid-market companies, and 500+ public sector organizations to improve operations, drive growth, and create value. At Slalom, we believe that together, we can move faster, dream bigger, and build better tomorrows for all.

Compensation And Benefits

Slalom prides itself on helping team members thrive in their work and life. As a result, Slalom is proud to invest in benefits that includeâ€¯meaningful time off and paid holidays, parental leave, 401(k) with a match, a range of choices for highly subsidized health, dental, & vision coverage, adoption and fertility assistance, and short/long-term disability. We also offer yearly $350 reimbursement account for any well-being-related expenses, as well as discounted home, auto, and pet insurance.

Slalom is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. For this position, the hourly pay range is $65 to $90/HR depending on experience. Actual compensation will depend upon an individualâ€™s skills, experience, qualifications, location, and other relevant factors. The hourly pay range is subject to change and may be modified at any time.

EEO and Accommodations

Slalom is an equal-opportunity employer and is committed to attracting, developing and retaining highly qualified talent who empower our innovative teams through unique perspectives and experiences. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteransâ€™ status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. Slalom will also consider qualified applications with criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Slalom welcomes and encourages applications from individuals with disabilities. Reasonable accommodations are available for candidates during all aspects of the selection process. Please advise the talent acquisition team if you require accommodations during the interview process.

We will accept applications on an ongoing basis through January 23, 2026

title: Associate Software Engineer - hybrid .NET or Java or Python 1
description:
Company Description

About CyberArk
CyberArk, a Palo Alto Networks company, is the global leader in identity security, trusted by organizations around the world to secure human and machine identities in the modern enterprise. CyberArk's AI-powered Identity Security Platform applies intelligent privilege controls to every identity with continuous threat prevention, detection and response across the identity lifecycle. With Identity Security, organizations can reduce operational and security risks by enabling zero trust and least privilege with complete visibility, empowering all users and identities, including workforce, IT, developers and machines, to securely access any resource, located anywhere, from everywhere. Learn more at cyberark.com.

Copyright 2026 CyberArk Software. All Rights Reserved. All other brand names, product names, or trademarks belong to their respective holders.

We are looking for an entry-level Software Engineer who is eager to learn and grow in the areas of scalable system development and identity/authentication technologies. In this role, you will work with experienced engineers to build core components of our platform, help improve system performance, and contribute to features used by customers at scale.

This is a great opportunity for someone early in their career who wants hands-on experience building cloud-based, distributed systems while learning best practices in identity, security, and modern software development. This position is a hybrid role based in Santa Clara, CA, requiring 2-3 days per week onsite. Relocation assistance is not available.Responsibilities:
â€¢ Work with senior engineers to design, develop, and test software components for our identity and scalability platform.
â€¢ Assist in implementing features, APIs, and backend services under guidance.
â€¢ Write clean, maintainable, and well-structured code following team standards.
â€¢ Participate in code reviews, learning how to write efficient and scalable software.
â€¢ Help investigate and resolve bugs or performance issues with the support of the team.
â€¢ Contribute to improving documentation, test coverage, and development workflows.
â€¢ Learn and apply modern development practices, including test-driven development and automation.
â€¢ Collaborate with product, QA, and infrastructure teams to understand requirements and deliver reliable solutions.
#LI-JH1
â€¢ LI-Hybrid

Qualifications
â€¢ Bachelor's degree in computer science, Engineering, or related technical discipline, or equivalent experience.
â€¢ Foundation in programming concepts and experience with .NET technologies (e.g., .NET / .NET Core or similar frameworks).
â€¢ Basic understanding of web technologies and building or consuming web services (REST APIs).
â€¢ Familiarity with databases (SQL or NoSQL) and interest in learning caching systems like Redis.
â€¢ Exposure to cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, or Azure) through coursework, projects, or internships is a plus.
â€¢ Interest in identity/authentication standards such as OAuth, OpenID Connect, or SAML (prior experience not required).
â€¢ Strong problem-solving skills and willingness to learn new tools, technologies, and concepts.
â€¢ Good communication skills and a collaborative mindset.
Additional Information

CyberArk is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of employment Visa at this time.

The salary range for this position is $88,000 - $130,000/year, plus discretionary bonus, which will be based on the employee's performance. Base pay may also vary considerably depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. The compensation package includes a wide range of medical, dental, vision, financial, and other benefits.

title: Associate Software Developer
description:
Vaco is actively seeking a Technical Training Specialist with previous software development and / or cloud experience for a direct-hire role supporting a nationally respected, technically focused, and rapidly growing organization in Memphis.
Position Summary

This role blends technical concepts with adult learning and instructional design capabilities to create high-impact corporate technical training.

The Trainer will research, design, build, and deliver practical learning experiences including application development, tool utilization, cloud platforms, DevOps practices, Agile methodologies, and emerging AI technologies.

This role is designed for a hands-on technologist who is ready to establish a career in corporate training and effective end-user system utilization.

The Trainer will deliver learning experiences covering cloud platforms, modern application development practices, DevOps fundamentals, Agile methodologies, proprietary software systems, and emerging AI tool utilization.

The ideal candidate will offer technical credibility, a passion for learning, and instructional curiosity along with the interpersonal attributes and confidence to facilitate educational experiences to audiences ranging from novice end-users to seasoned engineers.

Key Responsibilities:
Design, develop, and maintain primarily developer-focused training content including hands-on labs, tutorials, videos, presentations, and assessments.
Deliver both live and recorded training sessions to both technical and operational audiences, virtually and in person.
Translate complex IT concepts into clear, engaging, and outcome-driven learning experiences.
Apply adult learning and instructional design principles to ensure training is interactive, practical, and effective.
Own course content lifecycle within LMS to include creation, publishing, updates, reporting, and engagement analysis.
Collaborate with subject matter experts, engineers, and architects to develop curriculum and validate outcomes.
Build and maintain a reusable library of relevant content, templates, labs, and delivery standards.
Incorporate assessments and feedback mechanisms to measure learner understanding and course effectiveness.

Remain abreast and continuously update content to reflect changes in technical landscapes, industry advancements, cloud ecosystems, development frameworks, process automation, DevOps tooling, and AI advancements.

Required Qualifications:
Bachelors Degree in applicable field is desired, relevant experience is acceptable.
Previous skills and experience in software development, cloud ecosystems, tool utilization, or similar.
Demonstrated ability to quickly learn new technologies and confidently present them in structured training environments.
Prior exposure to adult education or corporate technical training environments is a plus.
Prior experience using a Learning Management System (LMS), preferably 360Learning, is a plus.
Ability to manage training content from design through delivery and performance reporting.
Strong interpersonal, presentation, written, verbal, and visual communication skills are required.

Additional Details

Employment Type:
Direct-Hire with Client

Primary Schedule:
Monday - Friday / 8a - 5p (CST)

Location:
Onsite - Memphis

Target Compensation:
$80k - $90k

Travel:
Up to 20%

Engagement Status:
Applicant must be currently authorized to work in the U.S.

without the need for employment-based sponsorship, now or in the future, including: H-1B, L-1, TN, O-1, E-3, H-1B1, F-1, J-1, OPT, CPT, or any other employment-based visa programs.
Interested Candidates are Encouraged to Apply for Immediate Consideration

Determining compensation for this role (and others) at Vaco/Highspring depends upon a wide array of factors including but not limited to the individual's skill sets, experience and training, licensure and certifications, office location and other geographic considerations, as well as other business and organizational needs.

With that said, as required by local law in geographies that require salary range disclosure, Vaco/Highspring notes the salary range for the role is noted in this job posting.

The individual may also be eligible for discretionary bonuses, and can participate in medical, dental, and vision benefits as well as the company's 401(k) retirement plan.

Additional disclaimer:
Unless otherwise noted in the job description, the position Vaco/Highspring is filing for is occupied. Please note, however, that Vaco/Highspring is regularly asked to provide talent to other organizations.

By submitting to this position, you are agreeing to be included in our talent pool for future hiring for similarly qualified positions.

Submissions to this position are subject to the use of AI to perform preliminary candidate screenings, focused on ensuring minimum job requirements noted in the position are satisfied.
Further assessment of candidates beyond this initial phase within Vaco/Highspring will be otherwise assessed by recruiters and hiring managers.

Vaco/Highspring does not have knowledge of the tools used by its clients in making final hiring decisions and cannot opine on their use of AI products.

title: Associate MLOps Engineer
description:
A company is looking for an Associate MLOps Engineer to support data science teams in building, deploying, and operating machine learning solutions at scale.
Key Responsibilities
Ensure efficient and reliable deployment of machine learning models into production environments

title: F-15 Mission Systems Software Engineer
description:
F-15 Mission Systems Software Engineer (Associate, Experienced, Senior)Company:
The Boeing CompanyThe Boeing Company is looking for a Software Engineer (Associate, Experienced & Senior) to join the F-15 Mission System Software Development Team located in Berkeley, MO. This position will focus on supporting the Boeing Defense, Space & Security (BDS) business organization.
The Boeing Company is currently seeking a Software Engineer (Associate, Experienced & Senior) to join the F15 Mission Systems Software team located in Berkeley, MO. We are seeking a highly motivated Software Engineer to design and implement new capabilities in the F-15 Operational Flight Program (OFP) for both the United States Air Force (USAF) and international customers. The candidate will join one of the multi-discipline Agile scrum teams that develop, integrate, and maintain a wide range of aircraft functionalities. Software capabilities will be developed for the Advanced Display Core Processor II (ADCP II), the brains of the Eagle. The successful candidate will implement and test new cutting-edge capabilities and integrate them with a variety of other aircraft subsystems.
At Boeing, our software engineers use their expertise to dream up next generation software capabilities for some amazing aerospace platforms. Boeing encourages its engineers to move up as technical leads as well as gives them opportunities to grow into management. Join us and you will have the unique opportunity to develop real-time embedded software for the most sophisticated military platforms in the world. Across Commercial, Defense and Global Services, our teams are developing software for next generation trainers; tactical fighter aircraft; helicopters; unmanned air vehicles; space, satellite, and weapons systems; state of the art flight simulators; cybersecurity solutions, and much more.
We work in a casual but professional environment with multi-disciplined teams of engineers that take pride in developing, integrating, testing and delivering innovative solutions. There is long-term potential for career growth into technical leadership or management positions and we value the curiosity, tenacity and imagination our engineers bring to our teams each day.
Position Responsibilities:
â€¢ Develops, documents and maintains architectures, requirements, algorithms, interfaces and designs for software systems

â€¢ Develops and maintains code and integrates software components into a fully functional software system

â€¢ Develops software verification plans, test procedures and test environments, executing the test procedures and documenting test results to ensure software system requirements are met

â€¢ Executes and documents software research and development projects

â€¢ Serves as a subject matter expert for software domains, system-specific issues, processes and regulations

â€¢ Troubleshoots software issues

â€¢ Works under general direction

â€¢

Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/ Experience):
â€¢ 2+ years of experience with professional software development

â€¢ 2+ years of experience in C/C++, Ada, and/or a similar object-oriented programming language

â€¢ 2+ years of experience developing, documenting, and maintaining architectures, algorithms, interfaces, and designs for software systems

Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):
â€¢ Bachelor of Science degree from an accredited course of study, in Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science, or other technical degree

â€¢ Agile/SAFe development experience

â€¢ Experience with DevOps tools, such as GitLab (CI/CD), Git Bash, Gradle, Jira, Jenkins, and Artifactory

â€¢ Desirable programming languages include: Ada, C, C++, Python

â€¢ Ability to work effectively in a team environment and communicate with stakeholders of different backgrounds and skill levels

â€¢ Experience developing embedded real-time software

â€¢ Experience working with Real-time Operating Systems (RTOS)

Drug Free Workplace:
Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.

The Boeing Company also provides eligible employees with an opportunity to enroll in a variety of benefit programs, generally including health insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and a number of programs that provide for both paid and unpaid time away from work.
The specific programs and options available to any given employee may vary depending on eligibility factors such as geographic location, date of hire, and the applicability of collective bargaining agreements.
Pay is based upon candidate experience and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations.

title: Junior Software Engineer
description:
Description

description:

At Bank of America, we are guided by a common purpose to help make financial lives better through the power of every connection. We do this by driving Responsible Growth and delivering for our clients, teammates, communities and shareholders every day.

Being a Great Place to Work is core to how we drive Responsible Growth. Job Description:
This job is responsible for developing and delivering complex requirements to accomplish business goals. Key responsibilities of the job include ensuring that software is developed to meet functional, non-functional and compliance requirements, coding solutions, unit testing, and ensuring the solution can be integrated successfully into the overall application/system with clear, robust, and well-tested interfaces. â€¢ Routine accountability is for technical knowledge and capabilities.

title: Software Engineer, Desktop
description:
About the Role
A1 is building a proactive AI system used daily across conversations, tools, and workflows.
You will own how this system behaves on desktop environments. Your work focuses on reliability, performance, and real-time behavior in production desktop applications.

Focus
â€¢ Build and maintain cross-platform desktop applications using Electron.
â€¢ Design responsive and scalable UIs for real-time collaboration.
â€¢ Implement desktop-specific functionality including file system access, native notifications, auto-updates, and deep linking.
â€¢ Integrate AI-powered features (chat, agents, AI assistance) via backend APIs.
â€¢ Optimize startup time, memory usage, and runtime performance.
â€¢ Profile and reduce Electron overhead.
â€¢ Manage large local state and message history efficiently.
â€¢ Ensure smooth real-time updates (messages, typing indicators, presence).
â€¢ Maintain stability across macOS and Windows environments.

Ideal Experiences
â€¢ Proven software engineering experience.
â€¢ Hands-on experience building production Electron applications.
â€¢ Strong proficiency in JavaScript and TypeScript.
â€¢ Experience with React or similar UI frameworks.
â€¢ Solid understanding of the desktop application lifecycle.
â€¢ Experience with IPC communication.
â€¢ Experience working with local storage (SQLite, IndexedDB, filesystem).
â€¢ Experience with WebSockets or other real-time transport mechanisms.
â€¢ Strong debugging and performance profiling skills.
â€¢ Familiarity with native OS behaviors on macOS or Windows.

Tech Stack
â€¢ Electron
â€¢ Node.js
â€¢ Typescript
â€¢ SQl & noSQL

Compensation Range
$255K â€“ $405K

How We Work
Our organization is very flat and our team is small, highly motivated, and focused on engineering and product excellence. All members are expected to be hands-on and to contribute directly to the companyâ€™s mission.

Interview process
If there appears to be a fit, we'll reach to schedule 3, but no more than 4 interviews.
Applications are evaluated by our technical team members. Interviews will be conducted via virtual meetings and/or onsite.
We value transparency and efficiency, so expect a prompt decision. If you've demonstrated the exceptional skills and mindset we're looking for, we'll extend an offer to join us. This isn't just a job offer; it's an invitation to be part of a team that's bringing AI to have practical benefits to billions globally.

title: Associate Software Engineer,
description:
Ascensus is the leading independent technology and service platform powering savings plans across America, providing products and expertise that help nearly 16 million people save for a better today and tomorrow.

Section 1: Position Summary

As an Associate Software Engineer at Ascensus, you will be working in a high-energy team, writing beautiful code by using the best engineering practices in the industry today (e.g. unit testing, source control, continuous integration, automation, design patterns). Passion for all aspects of software development is critical. We are building teams that are empowered to solve the business needs by having a rapid development and deployment pipeline with a focus on automation and releasing software.

As a Scrum team member, you will be responsible for delivering solutions that adhere to the software architecture strategy, coding standards, and established organizational policies and procedures.

Section 2: Job Functions, Essential Duties and Responsibilities
â€¢ Responsible for protecting, securing, and proper handling of all confidential data held by Ascensus to ensure against unauthorized access, improper transmission, and/or unapproved disclosure of information that could result in harm to Ascensus or our clients.
â€¢ Our I-Client service philosophy and our Core Values of People Matter, Quality First and Integrity AlwaysÂ® should be visible in your actions on a day to day basis showing your support of our organizational culture.
â€¢ Analyze, implement, test, document and maintain new and current software applications with minimal oversight in support of achieving the business goals.
â€¢ Assist in estimating and planning throughout the software development life cycle.
â€¢ Support people and process improvement strategies for the organization.
â€¢ Assist with other tasks and projects as assigned

Supervision
â€¢ N/A

Section 3: Experience, Skills, Knowledge Requirements
â€¢ 1+ years of experience developing software & systems for small to medium business environments
â€¢ Working experience in one or more programming languages, technologies and software platforms, such as C#, Java, JavaScript, MS-SQL Server, Sybase.
â€¢ Strong problem solving skills
â€¢ Understanding of design principles (patterns, cohesion/coupling, S.O.L.I.D.)
â€¢ Understanding of object-oriented design, data structures and algorithms
â€¢ Familiarity with Services Oriented Architecture and RESTful services development
â€¢ Passion for developing good software
â€¢ Experience participating in design discussions with both technical and non-technical audiences.
â€¢ Familiarity or experience with Agile engineering practices (test driven development, continuous integration and pair programming, etc.)
â€¢ Working experience with Python, C/C++, MySQL, Apache, Ngnix, Redis, JavaScript, jQuery, Knockout.js
â€¢ Experience in open source development
â€¢ Understanding of web technologies (HTTP, Apache, HTTP Proxies)
â€¢ Experience with continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD)
â€¢ Experience with working with legacy code

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

Be aware of employment fraud. All email communications from Ascensus or its hiring managers originate from @ascensus.com or @futureplan.com email addresses. We will never ask you for payment or require you to purchase any equipment. If you are suspicious or unsure about validity of a job posting, we strongly encourage you to apply directly through our website.

For all virtual remote positions, in order to ensure associates can effectively perform their job duties with no distractions, we require an uninterrupted virtual work space and there is also an expectation of family care being in place during business hours. Additionally, there is an internet work speed requirement of 25 MBps or better for individual use. If more than one person is utilizing the same internet connection in the same household or building, then a stronger connection is required. If you are unsure of your internet speed, please check with your service provider. Note: For call center roles specifically, it is a requirement to either hardwire your equipment directly to the internet router or ensure your workstation is in close proximity to the router. Please ensure that you are able to meet these expectations before applying.

Ascensus provides equal employment opportunities to all associates and applicants for employment without regard to ancestry, race, color, religion, sex, (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding and/or related medical conditions), gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition (including cancer and genetic characteristics), marital status, military or veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, criminal conviction record or any other protected category in accordance with applicable federal, state, or local laws ("Protected Status").

title: Associate Software Engineer
description:
WHO WE ARE

DebtBook is an industry-leading fintech software platform that revolutionizes the way local government higher education and healthcare finance teams work. Our powerful cloud-based software helps these organizations manage all aspects of their debt cash leases and subscriptions streamline financial reporting and share information simply with others. We are passionate about modernizing treasury management and simplifying accounting compliance in the public sector allowing organizations to break through operational barriers to unlock strategic insights.

HOW WE WORK
â€¢ Our application is a Majestic Monolith built with Ruby on Rails React and PostgreSQL. Our app is hosted in AWS and we use GitLab for our CI / CD pipelines and deployments. We use feature flags to allow us to continually integrate our code.
â€¢ Our front-end is built with React TypeScript and MUI React. We have an in-house library of accessible components documented in StoryBook. These components are being used in new development and we are in the process of updating existing pages to use them.
â€¢ Our back-end is a Ruby on Rails JSON API that communicates with a React SPA (single page application).
â€¢ All of our engineers work on the front-end back-end and database. We have some engineers who are much more experienced in one but we can all do some work in any part of the stack.
â€¢ We have a small dedicated infrastructure team but our teams deploy and monitor their own code.
â€¢ Engineers collaborate closely with product managers designers and industry specialists to understand problems and design solutions. Engineers manage breaking down work into tickets and planning and managing projects.

WHAT YOULL DO
â€¢ Participate in all stages of the SDLC : solution shaping system design ticket writing / breakdown write full-stack code review code perform deployments participate in monitoring and gather data for reporting.
â€¢ Own the quality of your work. Write tests and work with your team to ensure everything works before merging and releasing.
â€¢ Work cross-functionally on your team to ensure work is scoped to deliver quickly and deliver the right functionality.
â€¢ Work collaboratively with other cross functional product-focused teams.

WHAT YOULL BRING
â€¢ Experience with Ruby or React
â€¢ Some familiarity with front-end and back-end web development
â€¢ Ability to communicate complicated technical concepts well with teammates in all

functions including non-technical roles

WHY DEBTBOOK

DebtBook is a fast-growing company where we dream big move fast make an impact and bring joy to everything we do. Our core values drive our success as an organization and we are looking for talented teammates who share our passion for challenging the status quo innovating in all we do and wanting to make a difference.

When it comes to benefits and perks we are committed to supporting our employees well-being to make their lives better both in and out of the office. We offer :
â€¢ Location : Charlotte NC (Hybrid - Flexible)
â€¢ Annual salary range is $ based on experience
â€¢ Up to 5% annual bonus
â€¢ Equity (stock options) for all employees
â€¢ Comprehensive health dental and vision insurance
â€¢ 401(k) with 4% employer match
â€¢ Flexible work schedules and generous leave policies
â€¢ Professional development opportunities
â€¢ Stipend for remote workers to set up their ideal work space
â€¢ Annual Company Onsite

INTERVIEW PROCESS
â€¢ 30 min - Introduction Call
â€¢ 30 min - Behavioral Interview with Engineering Manager (Video call)
â€¢ 2 hr - Technical Interview with Engineers (Video call)
â€¢ Our technical assessment is a pair programming session designed to be very similar to our daily work. It is a collaborative session and it covers FE (react) BE (Ruby on Rails) and SQL schema design.
â€¢ 2 hr - Onsite Interview with members from the Product Design and Engineering teams
â€¢ This will be multiple panel interviews each containing 1-2 team members.

OUR GOAT VALUES

GROW Continuously
â€¢ We believe in continuous improvement never accepting the status quo as good enough and iterating to move quickly without compromising on quality.
â€¢ We are energized by the fast-paced rate of change that growth demands and see new challenges as opportunities for resilience and personal development.
â€¢ We are driven by curiosity to think creatively innovate and experiment and we humbly incorporate lessons learned from success and failure along the journey.

OWN Your Outcomes
â€¢ We hold ourselves accountable for exceptional effort execution reliability professionalism and results that add tremendous value for customers.
â€¢ We are all individual contributors responsible for delivering value to our customers team and company with every action we take.
â€¢ As managers we lead by example in both what we do and how we do it and stay personally familiar with the work as we coach our teams.
â€¢ We follow through on our decisions and commitments with action.

ABOVE & Beyond
â€¢ We create moments of magic surprising and delighting our customers at every touchpoint.
â€¢ We run towards problems and enthusiastically jump in to help colleagues however we can be valuable.
â€¢ We take pride in proactively doing the extra little things that set us apart even when no one is watching.

TEAM Over Ego
â€¢ There is no task needed at DebtBook that is beneath any of us.
â€¢ We work hard to be the teammate others want on their team.
â€¢ We have the courage to have hard conversations and the grace to receive honest feedback in pursuit of excellence.

DebtBook is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity and prohibit discrimination and unlawful harassment in the workplace. All applicants will receive consideration for employment based upon their qualifications without regard to race religion color national origin ethnicity gender gender identity or expression pregnancy sexual orientation age marital status genetic information political affiliation National Guard or veteran status disability or any other protected status under federal state or local law. We welcome and encourage applicants with disabilities to contact our team for assistance during the application and hiring process. We are committed to expanding accessibility and making reasonable accommodations in accordance with applicable law.

Digital Marketing,Graduate Engineering,ASP.NET,ABAP,Client Services,ERP

description:
Join ClearEdge and be part of a mission-focused team solving some of the DoD's most complex technical challenges. Every day, ClearEdge supports government and industry customers by delivering innovative solutions that enable critical operations and mission success. ClearEdge offers an extremely competitive benefits package-including a $10k annual training and education benefit, a 10% 401(k) contribution fully vested on day one, annual health and technology allowances, and access to a state-of-the-art technology lab. Learn more at www.clearedgeit.com/careers/ Your Mission: Build modern web-based Visualization Components, focused on audio and visual multimedia playback, supporting the Analyst to learn one capability to perform functions instead of multiple processes for similar capabilities . Detail oriented and team driven Software Engineers will provide full lifecycle support, to include modernization, of applications and tools. We are seeking a highly motivated Software Engineer that is well-versed with full-stack web-based application development using modular design principles. You will excel in this role if you are: * A software engineer who thinks tactically and strategically to successfully design, develop, and deploy automated solutions using a variety of tools across multiple platforms

â€¢ Versatile and able to meet quickly changing technology needs * Self-motivated to improve product efficiency
â€¢ Familiar with Agile principles and web-based software applications A day in the life consists of: * Designing, developing, and deploying multiple web-based visualization components focused on audio, visual, and other multimedia functions
â€¢ Working directly with customers, managers and technical staff to understand business needs, develop technical plans, and deliver solutions that solve mission problems * Applying your expertise to code, plan, test, and deploy software and repository solutions across network domains
â€¢ Connecting various elements of coding along with libraries and applications for software releases with various operating systems and production infrastructures
â€¢ Coordinating across multi-functional teams to formulate, prototype, implement, and fine tune solutions
â€¢ Providing multiple tier levels of support to customers, software development teams, and network engineers
â€¢ Establishing strong, collaborative working relationships with Government customers, technical staff, and peers * Sharing software engineering best practices and principles Must have: * TS/SCI with polygraph clearance * Bachelor's or Advanced Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or other technical discipline
â€¢ Experience developing and maintaining software solutions
â€¢ Experience with all aspects of full stack development
â€¢ Experience with web-based Javascript frameworks such as React, Vue, and Angular * Experience with object-oriented languages such as Java, JavaScript
â€¢ Experience with designing and developing modular components used in other applications
â€¢ Success troubleshooting complex problems
â€¢ Proven Linux background * Strong monitoring/metrics skills Nice to have: * Customer support experience ClearEdge is an established small business that values its employees and is committed to providing an environment where individuals can succeed and grow. We believe in developing our people, promoting from within, and fostering long-term career growth across the organization. Our Core Values-Honesty, Integrity, Loyalty, Fairness, Respect, Responsibility, and Accountability-guide everything we do. These principles shape our culture, inform our decisions, and drive our commitment to excellence in support of our customers and partners. If this position is not the right fit, we encourage you to visit our Careers page to explore other opportunities at ClearEdge or connect with one of our recruiters at [email protected]. ClearEdge is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Junior IT Services Engineer
description:
DISCLAIMER:
Authorization to work in the United States is required for this position. The NYC Department of City Planning does not offer sponsorship, of any kind, for any type of employment opportunity. Applicants are responsible for ensuring that they meet all minimum qualifying requirements for this position at the time of application.

THE AGENCY
The Department of City Planning (DCP) plans for the future of New York City, working to create thriving and dynamic neighborhoods with access to housing and jobs, resilient infrastructure, and a vibrant public realm. The Department engages communities to develop inclusive plans, expands housing access and economic opportunity, and plans for long-term sustainability.

DCP supports the City Planning Commission in its annual review of hundreds of land use applications. The Department also advises on citywide strategic and capital planning, analyzes data, conducts policy analysis, and creates open data and civic engagement tools.

The Department of City Planning offers staff meaningful opportunities to help shape the future of New York City and address some of its most pressing challenges. The Department values public service, collaboration, and creativity, and supports professional development. Learn more about DCP and view current job openings at www.nyc.gov/planning.

THE DIVISION
Information Technology Divisionâ€™s (ITD) vision is to become a dynamic and vibrant technology delivery organization of the New York City government that leads business transformations and technology innovations to enable citizen-centric smart urban planning, while promoting a culture of collaboration, talent development, and equity. ITD is responsible for developing technology solutions to support agency needs and citywide requests, including City Charter mandates, grant funding requirements, and citywide geospatial services, and maintaining systems infrastructure and endpoint assets, to optimize operational efficiency, promote innovation, and collaborate with other city agencies to enhance service accessibility to citizens. The division provides necessary computing infrastructure and productivity-enhancing technology tools in a hybrid mode (on premise and in the cloud), to support DCPâ€™s interdisciplinary staff across five boroughs, including planners, urban designers, project managers, and executive management. The division is comprised of experienced and talented software engineers, geographic specialists, service engineers, and technology leaders who specialize in managing system infrastructure, cyber security, geospatial data engineering, application services, and portfolio management.

Within ITD, the Technical Support Management (TSM) unit is responsible for ensuring customer success by providing excellent Help Desk services, deploying, and maintaining endpoint devices such as workstations, laptops, phones, video conference systems, and peripheral devices, and performing inventory and asset management. The unit plays the crucial role of being the face of the IT Division, and employs a customer-centric and solution-oriented approach on prioritizing and resolving technical issues promptly and efficiently, by troubleshooting hardware and software problems, network connectivity issues, system errors, and user provisioning, while employing proactive measures on preventive maintenance, customer education, feedback integration, and constant improvement of support processes, and building awareness on cybersecurity best practices for endpoint security. TSM is also responsible for the support and management of the agencyâ€™s mission critical audio/video infrastructure.

THE ROLE
The ITD TSM unit is seeking a talented and versatile Junior IT Services Engineer to join its team of dedicated IT Services Engineers to assist with IT Support, technology asset management, and inventory control. Under supervision and general direction, the Junior IT Services Engineerâ€™s responsibilities include, but may not be limited to:

- Conducts the configuration, troubleshooting, and repair of desktop, laptop, and Apple equipment as directed by a member of the Technical Support Management (TSM) team.
- Conducts the deployment of Laptops, Desktops, and peripheral devices to staff as directed by a member of the Technical Support Management (TSM) team.
- Performs imaging of desktop and laptop devices as directed by a member of the Technical Support Management (TSM) team.
- Performs the installation of software applications as directed by a member of the Technical Support Management (TSM) team.
- Assists with software patch deployment to the Windows, MacOS, iOS and Android endpoint platforms as directed by a member of the Technical Support Management (TSM) team.
- Provide Meeting Room Technology support for staff.
- Perform Asset Management tasks as directed by a member of the Technical Support Management (TSM) team.
- Provides software troubleshooting and resolutions.
- Assists with the relinquishment of retired IT assets as directed by a member of the Technical Support Management (TSM) team.
- Provides Audio/Video support for the DCP public engagements as directed by a member of the TSM Support Management (TSM) team.
- Other duties and responsibilities as required.

TO APPLY:
Please visit: https://cityjobs.nyc.gov/ and follow the steps below:

1. Search for job ID number: 770668
2. Click on the job business title: Junior IT Services Engineer
3. Click on â€œApply Nowâ€ at the bottom of the posting

Note: All interested candidates must submit their applications via cityjobs.nyc.gov Applications via regular mail, fax or e-mail will not be accepted.

Authorization to work in the United States is required for this position. The NYC Department of City Planning does not offer sponsorship, of any kind, for any type of employment opportunity. Applicants are responsible for ensuring that they meet all minimum qualifying requirements for this position at the time of application.

Only applicants under consideration will be contacted. Appointments are subject to Office of Management and Budget (OMB) approval.

The City of New York is an inclusive equal opportunity employer committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse workforce and providing a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment based upon any legally protected status or protected characteristic, including but not limited to an individual's sex, race, color, ethnicity, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, gender identity, or pregnancy.

This position may be eligible for remote work up to 2 days per week, pursuant to the Remote Work Pilot Program agreed to between the City and labor unions.

NOTE: If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation during your visit or have questions regarding the accessibility of our facilities, please reach out to accessibilityinfo@planning.nyc.gov or call 212-720-3508 at least three business days prior to your arrival.

IT SERVICE MANAGEMENT SPECIALI - 95713

Minimum Qualifications

1. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college in computer science, engineering or a related field and four years of satisfactory full-time experience related to information technology service management, process management, operations;

2. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and eight years of satisfactory full-time experience related to information technology service management, process management, operations;

3. Education and/or experience which is equivalent to "1" or "2" above.

Preferred Skills

- One year of full-time desktop support experience in Windows and MacOS platforms.
- One year of full-time experience supporting Dell Desktops and Laptops, HP Printers, iPhones, iPads and MacBooks.
- One year of full-time experience with installing, troubleshooting and repair of the following software:
+ Microsoft Windows 11
+ Microsoft Office 365 - Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, OneDrive
+ Microsoft Teams and Zoom Video Conferencing platforms
+ ESRI and Adobe creative suite software applications
- Intermediate experience with the IP Config commands and Windows registry.
- Strong verbal communication skills.
- Ability to work with a variety of personality types.
- Experience working with inventory control is helpful but not necessary.
- Ability to work well independently and in a group.
- High level of professionalism and organizational skills.
- Detail oriented, quick learner and the ability to adapt quickly and efficiently in a fast-paced environment.
- Ability to lift computer equipment up to a weight of 50 pounds.
Public Service Loan Forgiveness

As a prospective employee of the City of New York, you may be eligible for federal loan forgiveness programs and state repayment assistance programs. For more information, please visit the U.S. Department of Educationâ€™s website at https://studentaid.gov/pslf/.
Residency Requirement

New York City Residency is not required for this position
Additional Information

The City of New York is an inclusive equal opportunity employer committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse workforce and providing a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment based upon any legally protected status or protected characteristic, including but not limited to an individual's sex, race, color, ethnicity, national origin, age, religion, disability, sexual orientation, veteran status, gender identity, or pregnancy.

title: Junior Software Engineer
description:
Description

JOB OVERVIEW
The Junior Software Engineer works as part of an agile delivery team alongside senior developers, product owners, and business stakeholders to deliver software solutions in iterative sprints. Applies foundational technical knowledge and grows expertise in designated technical disciplines and specific platforms. Works to understand business and technical requirements and translates them into functional technical solutions with guidance from experienced team members. Participates in daily standups, sprint planning, and retrospectives while learning to deliver value incrementally in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.
RESPONSIBILITIES & DUTIES
â€¢ Develops and maintains financial applications (web and windows) under guidance of senior developers
â€¢ Learns to translate business requirements and objectives into technical applications and solutions
â€¢ Completes assigned technical tasks, troubleshoots issues, and researches new methods and systems with supervision and mentorship
â€¢ Contributes to the success of core systems by following established patterns and best practices
â€¢ Participates in designing, developing, testing, and supporting application releases
â€¢ Participates in code reviews to learn coding best practices, unit testing, security, scalability, and maintainability guidelines
â€¢ Creates and maintains documentation, including operating procedures and technical specifications
â€¢ Implements enhancements to applications and interfaces with client systems as directed
â€¢ Researches software-related technologies and products to support team recommendations
â€¢ Follows established change control procedures and standards
â€¢ Learns and adopts best practices for delivery methodologies
â€¢ Performs other duties as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS
â€¢ Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field; OR completion of recognized coding bootcamp program; OR equivalent combination of education and relevant project/internship experience
â€¢ 0-1 years of professional Information Technology experience
â€¢ Financial services experience a plus but not required
â€¢ Strong desire to learn and grow technical skills in a professional environment

PROFESSIONAL CERTIFICATIONS
â€¢ None required

TECHNICAL SKILLS
To be successful in this role, you should have experience with and an understanding of the following:
â€¢ Foundational programming knowledge in at least one C-based language (Java, C#, or similar)
â€¢ Basic understanding of web technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript)
â€¢ Object-Oriented Design (OOD) principles
â€¢ Software testing concepts (unit, integration, functional)
â€¢ Version Control System basics (GIT preferred)
â€¢ Code debugging fundamentals
â€¢ Ability to read and understand API documentation
â€¢ Exposure to REST APIs and web services preferred
â€¢ Familiarity with Agile software development methodology preferred
â€¢ Basic SQL knowledge preferred
â€¢ Experience with package managers (NuGet, Maven, NPM, or Gradle) preferred
â€¢ Understanding of build and deployment concepts preferred
â€¢ Personal projects or coursework demonstrating coding ability preferred
â€¢ Cloud platform exposure (Azure, AWS, or similar) preferred
â€¢ Salesforce Development preferred

CULTURAL COMPETENCIES
In addition to our core company competencies of Cultivates Innovation, Nimble Learning, Action Oriented, Collaborates, and Being Resilient, a successful candidate in this role should exhibit the following behavioral competencies:
â€¢ Tech Savvy
â€¢ Communicates Effectively
â€¢ Resourcefulness
â€¢ Being Resilient

PHYSICAL DEMANDS/WORK ENVIRONMENT
This job operates in a professional office environment and routinely uses standard office equipment. While performing the duties of this job, the associate is regularly required to speak and hear. The associate is frequently required to sit for extended periods of time, as well as stand, walk, use hands and fingers, and reach with hands and arms. This job requires the ability to lift files, open filing cabinets, and bend or stand on a stool as necessary.
DISCLAIMER/ASSOCIATE ACKNOWLEDGEMENT
The above statements describe the general nature and level of work only. They are not an exhaustive list of all required responsibilities, duties, and skills. Other duties may be added, or this description amended at any time.

Clearance: Ability to obtain and maintain a secret government security clearance. Preferred Requirements Currently hold a U.S. security clearance. Experience in the DoD contractor space, especially maritime. Experience in leading junior software engineers. Strong background in embedded Linux kernels, filesystems, and custom device drivers. Experience with communications and networking libraries in embedded Linux (e.g. networking stacks, Protocol Buffers/Protobuf/data serialization). Passionate about protecting the American warfighter. Experience with RF communication links and/or radio systems. Physical Requirements Adequate visual acuity and manual dexterity for meeting the requirements Software Engineer family. HII is more than a job - itâ€™s an opportunity to build a new future. We offer competitive benefits such as best-in-class medical, dental and vision plan choices; wellness resources; employee assistance programs; Savings Plan Options (401(k)); financial planning tools, life insurance; employee discounts; paid holidays and paid time off; tuition reimbursement; as well as early childhood and post-secondary education scholarships. Bonus/other non-recurrent compensation is occasionally offered for qualified positions, and if applicable to this role will be addressed by the recruiter at the screening phase of application. Why HII We build the worldâ€™s most powerful, survivable naval ships and defense technology solutions that safeguard our seas, sky, land, space and cyber. Our workforce includes skilled tradespeople; artificial intelligence, machine learning (AI/ML) experts; engineers; technologists; scientists; logistics experts; and business administration professionals. Recognized as one of Americaâ€™s top large company employers, we are a values and ethics driven organization that puts peopleâ€™s safety and well-being first. Regardless of your role or where you serve, at HII, youâ€™ll find a supportive and welcoming environment, competitive benefits, and valuable educational and training programs for continual career growth at every stage of your career. Together we are working to ensure a future where everyone can be free and thrive. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, physical or mental disability, age, or veteran status or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law. Do You Need Assistance? If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to buildyourcareer@hii-co.com and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Reasonable accommodations are considered on a case-by-case basis. Please note that only those inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this email address.
