title: (USA) Software Engineer III
description:
Position Summary...

What you'll do...Participates in the discovery phase of small to medium-sized projects to come up with high level design by partnering with the product management, project management, business, and user experience teams. Troubleshoots business and production issues by gathering information (for example, issue, impact, criticality, possible root cause); performing root cause analysis to reduce future issues; engaging support teams to assist in the resolution of issues; developing solutions; driving the development of an action plan; performing actions as designated in the plan; interpreting the results to determine further action; and completing online documentation. Manages small to large-sized complex projects by reviewing project requirements; translating requirements into technical solutions; researching and identifying alternative solutions; determining needed solution based on return on investment and value add to the business; gathering requested information (for example, design documents, product requirements, wire frames); writing and developing code; conducting unit testing; communicating status and issues to team members and stakeholders; collaborating with project team and cross functional teams; identifying areas of opportunity; interpreting information and identifying a solution; ensuring solution is sustainable across implementation and use; troubleshooting open issues and bug-fixes; and ensuring on-time delivery and hand-offs. Provides support to the business by responding to user questions, concerns, and issues (for example, technical feasibility, implementation strategies); researching and identifying needed solutions; determining implementation designs; providing guidance regarding implications of new and enhanced systems; identifying short and long term solutions; and directing users to appropriate contacts for issues outside of associate's domain. Assists in providing guidance to small groups of two to three engineers, including offshore associates, for assigned Engineering projects by proving pertinent documents, directions, examples, and timeline. Requirement And Scoping Analysis: Requires knowledge of: Traceability matrix; Risk analysis methodologies; Cost Analysis; Business objectives; Classification of requirements; User stories To understand the Business/Stakeholder/Technical requirements and assist in analyzing the existing solutions to address the needs (in case of agile methodology, for the iteration). Prepare requirement traceability matrix and maintain traceability between business requirements, functional requirements, design and test cases. Contribute to the creation of user stories for component/module/simple requirements ( for example: based on scalability etc.) (For agile methodology). Coding: Requires knowledge of: Coding standards and guidelines; Coding languages (E.g. JavaScript, Python, C# etc.), frameworks(E.g. ActiveX, .Net, Cocoa, Android application framework etc.), tools(E.g. Monday.com, Linx, Embold etc.) and Platforms (E.g. Microsoft Azure, AWS , Apple IOS etc.); Quality, Safety and Security (PCI etc) standards; Emerging tools and technologies; Telemetry. To create/configure minimalistic code for entire component/application and ensure the components are meeting business/technical requirements, non-functional requirements, low-maintainability, high-availability and high-scalability needs. Assist in the selection of appropriate languages (E.g. JavaScript, Python, C# etc.), development standards and tools (E.g. Monday.com, Linx, Embold etc.)for software coding/configuration. Take initiative to learn the fundamentals of different coding languages and frameworks that would be useful for future scope of work. Build scripts for automation of repetitive and routine tasks in CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery), Testing or any other process(as applicable). Implement telemetry features as required independently. Ensure security policy requirements are properly applied to components/application during code development/configuration. Testing: Requires knowledge of: Test case preparation; Test Objectives; Test Strategy; Test types; Test tools (E.g. - Automation - Selenium, Agile - Jira, Mobile - Eggplant etc.); Test Environment; Root cause analysis. To map the customer requirements in to test objectives. Identify and create test cases for the component/module. Execute test cases to test the code and detect errors and defects for the entire component. Execute different types of testing using appropriate testing tools based on the testing needs. Defect Management and Troubleshooting: Requires knowledge of: Defect life-cycle process, defect tracking tools and methodologies; Defect reporting; Regression testing; Root cause analysis; Root cause corrective action. To track and analyze defects for the component/ module and carry out regression testing to fix defects in all instances of code changes. Analyze defects from past projects/solutions to avoid recurrence of similar defects. Troubleshoot performance and availability bottlenecks for the application. DevOps Orientation: Requires knowledge of: Different operating systems; Software maintenance tools and techniques; Application monitoring tools and techniques; Debugging tools; Mock screen; Pseudocodes; Reverse Engineering; Traceability matrix; System performance, security, integration; Data migration and accessibility; Design Methodologies. To conduct complex maintenance procedures for applications independently. Monitor and evaluate the performance of the application by tracking and analyzing appropriate metrics; Perform maintenance (corrective, adaptive, perfective) and re-engineering activities. Analyze application logs, maintenance activity data, performance data and provide analysis; Evaluate change requests to identify those which are valid and feasible. Program Monitoring: Requires knowledge of: Program metrics; Program Reporting, logging tools and processes; Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CICD) To ensure adherence to the project against approved milestones and timelines. Coordinates, completes, and oversees job-related activities and assignments by developing and maintaining relationships with key stakeholders; supporting plans and initiatives to meet customer and business needs; identifying and communicating goals and objectives; building accountability for and measuring progress in achieving results; identifying and addressing improvement opportunities; and demonstrating adaptability and promoting continuous learning. Provides supervision and development opportunities for associates by hiring and training; mentoring; assigning duties; providing recognition; and promoting a belonging mindset in workplace. Ensures compliance with company policies and procedures and supports company mission, values, and standards of ethics and integrity by implementing related action plans; utilizing and supporting the Open Door Policy; and providing direction and guidance on applying these in executing business processes and practices. Agile Methodology, Software Design, Project Management Respect the Individual: Demonstrates and encourages respect for all; builds a high-performing team; seeks, and embraces differences in people, cultures, ideas and experiences; creates a workplace where all associates feel seen, supported and connected through culture of belonging so associates thrive and perform; drives a positive associate and customer/member experience for all; identifies, attracts, and retains the best team members. Respect the Individual: Creates a discipline and focus around developing talent, through feedback, coaching, mentoring, and developmental opportunities; promotes an environment allowing everyone to bring their best selves to work; empowers associates and partners to act in the best interest of the customer/member and company; and regularly recognizes othersâ€™ contributions and accomplishments. Respect the Individual: Builds strong and trusting relationships with team members and business partners; works collaboratively and cross-functionally to achieve objectives; and communicates and listens attentively, with energy and positivity to motivate, influence, and inspire commitment and action. Act with Integrity: Maintains and promotes the highest standards of integrity, ethics and compliance; models the Walmart values and leads by example to foster our culture; supports Walmartâ€™s goal of becoming a regenerative company by making a positive impact for associates, customers, and the world around us (e.g., creating a sense of belonging, eliminating waste, participating in local giving). Act with Integrity: Follows the law, our code of conduct and company policies, and sets expectations for others to do the same; promotes an environment where associates feel comfortable sharing concerns and reinforces our culture of non-retaliation; listens to concerns raised by associates. takes action and encourages others to do the same; holds self and others accountable for achieving results in a way that is consistent with our values. Act with Integrity: Acts as an altruistic servant leader and is consistently humble, self-aware, honest, and transparent. Serve our Customers and Members: Delivers expected business results while putting the customer/member first and consistently applying an omni-merchant mindset and acts with an Every Day Low-Cost mindset to drive value and Every Day Low Prices for customers/members. Serve our Customers and Members: Adopts a holistic perspective that considers data, analytics, customer/member insights, and different parts of the business when making plans and shaping the teamâ€™s strategy. Strive for Excellence: Consistently raises the bar and seeks to improve; demonstrates curiosity and a growth mindset; seeks feedback, asks thoughtful questions, fosters an environment that supports learning, innovation, and learning from mistakes, and intelligent risk-taking; and exhibits resilience in the face of setbacks. Strive for Excellence: Seeks and implements continuous improvements and encourages the team to leverage new digital tools and ways of working. At Sam's Club, we offer competitive pay as well as performance-based bonus awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet!
-Health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage

-Financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company-paid life insurance

-Paid time off benefits include PTO, parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty, and voting. You will also receive PTO and/or PPTO that can be used for vacation, sick leave, holidays, or other purposes. The amount you receive depends on your job classification and length of employment. It will meet or exceed the requirements of paid sick leave laws, where applicable.

For information about PTO, see https://one.walmart.com/notices.

- Other benefits include short-term and long-term disability, company discounts, Military Leave Pay, adoption and surrogacy expense reimbursement, and more.
Live Better U is a company paid education benefit program for full-time and part-time associates in Walmart and Sam's Club facilities. Programs range from high school completion to bachelor's degrees, including English Language Learning and short-form certificates. Tuition, books, and fees are completely paid for by Walmart.
Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to a specific plan or program terms.

For information about benefits and eligibility, see One.Walmart.
The annual salary range for this position is $90,000.00 - $180,000.00 Additional compensation includes annual or quarterly performance bonuses. Additional compensation for certain positions may also include Regional Pay Zone (RPZ) (based on location).

Provides support to the business by responding to user questions, concerns, and issues (for example, technical feasibility, implementation strategies); researching and identifying needed solutions; determining implementation designs; providing guidance regarding implications of new and enhanced systems; identifying short and long term solutions; and directing users to appropriate contacts for issues outside of associate's domain. Assists in providing guidance to small groups of two to three engineers, including offshore associates, for assigned Engineering projects by proving pertinent documents, directions, examples, and timeline. Requirement And Scoping Analysis: Requires knowledge of: Traceability matrix; Risk analysis methodologies; Cost Analysis; Business objectives; Classification of requirements; User stories To understand the Business/Stakeholder/Technical requirements and assist in analyzing the existing solutions to address the needs (in case of agile methodology, for the iteration). Prepare requirement traceability matrix and maintain traceability between business requirements, functional requirements, design and test cases. Contribute to the creation of user stories for component/module/simple requirements ( for example: based on scalability etc.) (For agile methodology). Coding: Requires knowledge of: Coding standards and guidelines; Coding languages (E.g. JavaScript, Python, C# etc.), frameworks(E.g. ActiveX, .Net, Cocoa, Android application framework etc.), tools(E.g. Monday.com, Linx, Embold etc.) and Platforms (E.g. Microsoft Azure, AWS , Apple IOS etc.); Quality, Safety and Security (PCI etc) standards; Emerging tools and technologies; Telemetry. To create/configure minimalistic code for entire component/application and ensure the components are meeting business/technical requirements, non-functional requirements, low-maintainability, high-availability and high-scalability needs. Assist in the selection of appropriate languages (E.g. JavaScript, Python, C# etc.), development standards and tools (E.g. Monday.com, Linx, Embold etc.)for software coding/configuration. Take initiative to learn the fundamentals of different coding languages and frameworks that would be useful for future scope of work. Build scripts for automation of repetitive and routine tasks in CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery), Testing or any other process(as applicable). Implement telemetry features as required independently. Ensure security policy requirements are properly applied to components/application during code development/configuration. Testing: Requires knowledge of: Test case preparation; Test Objectives; Test Strategy; Test types; Test tools (E.g. - Automation - Selenium, Agile - Jira, Mobile - Eggplant etc.); Test Environment; Root cause analysis. To map the customer requirements in to test objectives. Identify and create test cases for the component/module. Execute test cases to test the code and detect errors and defects for the entire component. Execute different types of testing using appropriate testing tools based on the testing needs. Defect Management and Troubleshooting: Requires knowledge of: Defect life-cycle process, defect tracking tools and methodologies; Defect reporting; Regression testing; Root cause analysis; Root cause corrective action. To track and analyze defects for the component/ module and carry out regression testing to fix defects in all instances of code changes. Analyze defects from past projects/solutions to avoid recurrence of similar defects. Troubleshoot performance and availability bottlenecks for the application. DevOps Orientation: Requires knowledge of: Different operating systems; Software maintenance tools and techniques; Application monitoring tools and techniques; Debugging tools; Mock screen; Pseudocodes; Reverse Engineering; Traceability matrix; System performance, security, integration; Data migration and accessibility; Design Methodologies. To conduct complex maintenance procedures for applications independently. Monitor and evaluate the performance of the application by tracking and analyzing appropriate metrics; Perform maintenance (corrective, adaptive, perfective) and re-engineering activities. Analyze application logs, maintenance activity data, performance data and provide analysis; Evaluate change requests to identify those which are valid and feasible. Program Monitoring: Requires knowledge of: Program metrics; Program Reporting, logging tools and processes; Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CICD) To ensure adherence to the project against approved milestones and timelines. Coordinates, completes, and oversees job-related activities and assignments by developing and maintaining relationships with key stakeholders; supporting plans and initiatives to meet customer and business needs; identifying and communicating goals and objectives; building accountability for and measuring progress in achieving results; identifying and addressing improvement opportunities; and demonstrating adaptability and promoting continuous learning. Provides supervision and development opportunities for associates by hiring and training; mentoring; assigning duties; providing recognition; and promoting a belonging mindset in workplace. Ensures compliance with company policies and procedures and supports company mission, values, and standards of ethics and integrity by implementing related action plans; utilizing and supporting the Open Door Policy; and providing direction and guidance on applying these in executing business processes and practices. title: (USA) Software Engineer III
description:
Position Summary...The Software Engineer III will lead the delivery of scoped features and services through collaborative teams, ensuring alignment with platform and business objectives. This role involves designing, developing and implementing test automation to validate the high quality of the solutions. The engineer will drive continuous improvement, conduct code reviews, and support operational excellence through proactive monitoring and debugging. Strong technical judgment, effective communication, and a product-driven mindset are essential to translate complex requirements into scalable, maintainable systems that enhance customer and business outcomes.

What you'll do...About the team:
Our team develops the UI/UX of the TV, focusing on innovation, collaboration, and technical excellence. As a Software Engineer III, you will help shape the technology roadmap and advance Walmart's mission to deliver value and quality at scale. The team applies expertise in software development, solution design, and testing to build reliable products that meet business and technical requirements. Continuous improvement and operational excellence are central to our approach, ensuring seamless experiences for users worldwide.

What you'll do:
â€¢ ï»¿ï»¿Lead delivery of features and components through collaboration with engineering teams, ensuring alignment with platform and business objectives.
â€¢ ï»¿ï»¿Integrate Al/ML components and leverage generative Al tools to enhance the software quality.
â€¢ ï»¿ï»¿Participate in root cause and test escape analysis to insure fewer future defects.
â€¢ ï»¿ï»¿Collaborate cross-functionally to translate complex problems into actionable technical requirements and measurable outcomes.
â€¢ ï»¿ï»¿Monitor application performance, support CI/CD pipelines, and drive continuous improvement in software delivery and reliability.
â€¢ ï»¿ï»¿Mentor peers, share knowledge, and promote engineering excellence within the team.

What you'll bring:
â€¢ ï»¿ï»¿Minimum of 4+ years of professional software development experience, with consumer electronics experience.
â€¢ Minimum of 2+ years of experience with a modern UI/UX Framework React , React Native, Angular, or Svelte.
â€¢ ï»¿ï»¿Proven ability to deliver test automation through collaboration with engineering teams.
â€¢ ï»¿ï»¿Skilled in code review, debugging, and continuous integration/deployment processes.
â€¢ ï»¿ï»¿Experience integrating Al/ML components and leveraging generative Al tools to enhance code quality.
â€¢ ï»¿ï»¿Effective collaboration and communication skills with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
â€¢ ï»¿ï»¿Commitment to engineering excellence, innovation, and continuous improvement.
â€¢ Experience with embedded software system is a plus.
â€¢ Experience with some form of OOP in software development with proficiency in languages such as Python and C++ is a plus.

title: Deployment Engineer
description:
Own Every Moment at NetApp

At NetApp, your ideas power innovation. We lead in intelligent data infrastructureâ€”delivering unified storage, integrated data services, and solutions that help organizations unlock the full potential of their data, from AI to multicloud.

Ready to innovate and contribute to our path to $10B? Here, you'll collaborate with passionate teams, tackle real-world challenges, and see your impact in how customers transform and grow. If you're ready to bring curiosity, creativity, and drive to every moment, NetApp is where your journey begins.

Job Summary

At NetApp, we help customers turn operational complexity into opportunity through intelligent data infrastructure. Our success depends on the reliability and predictability of our cloud services, and that begins with disciplined release management, strong change governance, and seamless coordination across engineering teams.

We are seeking an Deployment Manager to support release execution activities across a cloud storage service. In this role, you will contribute to safe and timely production deployments by ensuring that release processes and change management workflows are executed with high quality and attention to detail.

You will work closely across Engineering teams and crossâ€‘functional partners to keep releases moving efficiently, ensure compliance with change management requirements, and provide operational visibility to leadership. Based on experiences with driving software deployment, you will generate a roadmap to automate and optimize processes making software deployment more robust and efficient. The roadmap will include building a framework for engineering teams to conduct their own software deployment autonmously, ensuring adequate service health validation checks are in place and reporting is available for passive use. This is an excellent role for someone early in their career who is detailâ€‘oriented, processâ€‘driven, and passionate about reliability, quality, and operational excellence.

Success Profile

A successful Deployment Manager typically demonstrates the following traits:
â€¢ Detailâ€‘oriented and methodical
â€¢ Organized with strong taskâ€‘tracking habits
â€¢ Clear communicator across async and realâ€‘time channels
â€¢ Comfortable with fastâ€‘paced, multiâ€‘stakeholder environments
â€¢ Processâ€‘minded with interest in operational rigor
â€¢ Eager to learn, ask questions, and grow domain expertise
â€¢ Collaborative, supportive, and dependable
â€¢ Familiar with CI / CD pipelines and general software deployment methodologies
â€¢ Has experience with coordinating incident response to quickly mitigate software deployment blockers and/or service health issues.

Responsibilities

Release Management Support

â€¢ Assist in coordinating release preparation and handoff activities across engineering teams.
â€¢ Ensure required preâ€‘release inputs (e.g., configuration merges, build validation, dependency readiness) are complete before releases enter staging or production pipelines.
â€¢ Support the queuing and tracking of releases in CI/CD pipelines, monitoring for progression, blocks, or delays.

Change Request Preparation

â€¢ Prepare change requests with accurate build data, affected components, justification, and required details.
â€¢ Conduct firstâ€‘pass validations of change requests to ensure completness, and compliance with evolving partner rules.
â€¢ Route change requests to appropriate approvers and monitor the approval chain, escalating when delays occur.
â€¢ Support routine renewal/update cycles for deployment that are exempt from rigorous change management processes.

Deployment Coordination

â€¢ Coordinate across engineering teams to facilitate production deployments.
â€¢ File and track support cases and bug reports as required to initiate or unblock deployments.
â€¢ Monitor deployment progress, track success/partialâ€‘success/failure signals, and capture notes for followâ€‘up.
â€¢ Assist with retry workflows by incorporating updated build numbers and ensuring corresponding change requests are filed correctly.

Operational Reporting & Communication

â€¢ Prepare and share deployment updates in the appropriate communication channels and meetings.
â€¢ Update dashboards and Confluence pages to reflect current deployment status, release progression, and changes in readiness criteria.
â€¢ Summarize key updates for recurring release syncs and engineering review meetings.
â€¢ Maintain accurate records of operational activity, approvals, and changes to support incident reviews and retrospectives.

Process Documentation & Continuous Improvement

â€¢ Maintain internal documentation for change request submission, release handoff and deployment workflows.
â€¢ Identify recurring gaps in release inputs, late configuration merges, or missed readiness tasks and help propose procedural improvements. Generate a backlog of improvements, prioritize improvements based on impact and drive for desired outcomes.
â€¢ Assist in implementing process refinements recommended by senior engineering and production leaders.
â€¢ Participate in retrospectives and governance forums, capturing action items and updating documentation accordingly.

Job Requirements

Minimum Qualifications

â€¢ 3+ years of experience in software, operations, program coordination, or a technical support role.
â€¢ This position requires US Citizenship or Permanent US Resident status. We cannot sponsor any work visas (H1B, etc.) for this role.
â€¢ Strong attention to detail, organizational skills, and ability to manage multiple concurrent tasks.
â€¢ Effective written and verbal communication across technical and nonâ€‘technical audiences.
â€¢ Experience working with ticketing, workflow, or change management tools (e.g., ServiceNow, Azure DevOps, EV2, Jira).
â€¢ Interest in cloud services, production operations, DevOps practices, and reliability engineering.

Preferred Qualifications

â€¢ Experience with Python and/or Powershell automation.
â€¢ Familiarity with release pipelines, deployment workflows, or change governance (R2D/SafeFly experience a plus).
â€¢ Exposure to Azure, cloud computing concepts, or distributed systems.
â€¢ Ability to interpret technical documentation (e.g., deployment guides, configuration change specs).
â€¢ Experience contributing to process or documentation improvement efforts.

Education

â€¢ Bachelorâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or equivalent practical experience.
â€¢ This position requires US Citizenship or Permanent US Resident status. We cannot sponsor any work visas (H1B, etc.) for this role.

Compensation:

The target salary range for this position is $131,000-$164,000. The salary offered will be determined by the candidate's location, qualifications, experience, and education and may be outside of this range. The range is based on 'On Target Earningsâ€™ (OTE) representing the total potential earnings, which is the sum of the base salary and potential commission earned when performance targets are achieved. Final compensation packages are competitive and in line with industry standards, reflecting a variety of factors, and include a comprehensive benefits package. This may cover Health Insurance, Life Insurance, Retirement or Pension Plans, Paid Time Off, various Leave options, employee stock purchase plan, and/or restricted stocks (RSUâ€™s). These offerings are subject to regional variations and governed by local laws, regulations, and company policies. We will provide detailed information about the specific benefits for your region during the recruitment process.

At NetApp, we embrace a hybrid working environment designed to strengthen connection, collaboration, and culture for all employees. This means that most roles will have some level of in-office and/or in-person expectations, which will be shared during the recruitment process.

Equal Opportunity Employer:

NetApp is firmly committed to Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and to compliance with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit employment discrimination based on age, race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, disability or genetic information, pregnancy, protected veteran status, and any other protected classification.

Why You'll Thrive at NetApp

At NetApp, you won't wait for the perfect momentâ€”you'll make it. The early planning, the extra thought, the bold idea that turns good into great: That's how our people operate and how we continue to push the boundaries of data infrastructure.

NetApp is the trusted partner for organizations transforming data into opportunity. As the only enterprise-grade storage service natively embedded in Google Cloud, AWS, and Microsoft Azure, we empower customers to run everything from traditional workloads to enterprise AI with unmatched performance, resilience, and security.

Our culture

We celebrate mold breakers, bold thinkers, and problem solvers. We reward initiative, impact, and ownership. We provide flexibility so you can balance professional ambition with your personal life. Here, differences are not just welcomedâ€”they drive everything we do.

If you're ready to innovate, rise to the challenge, and own every moment - make your next move your best one. Apply now.

title: Software Engineer
description:
The Role:

At Morningstar, helping investors is what brings us together and drives our work. We are looking for software engineers who specialize in .NET, Python, AWS, and modern platform development to join our team, grow with us, introduce us to new ideas and develop products that empower our users.

We are evolving our content management system with AI-enabled capabilities to improve content workflows, discovery, and automation. Weâ€™re looking for engineers who are excited to learn, experiment, and apply emerging technologies alongside strong engineering fundamentals.

This role is ideal for a backend or platform-focused software engineer who enjoys building production systems and is curious about applying AI in practical ways. Every day, youâ€™ll partner with team members across disciplines to develop products for investors. Youâ€™ll interact with product managers and business stakeholders to understand our domain and create technical solutions that push us forward. You will be a member of a vibrant technical community, sharing your knowledge while also learning from fellow technologists. These positions are based in our Chicago office.

Responsibilities
â€¢ Build well-designed, stable, secure, and scalable content platform services and applications.
â€¢ Develop and enhance capabilities for content management, ingestion, workflows, search, and distribution.
â€¢ Design and implement RESTful APIs and backend services using Python, .NET, and AWS.
â€¢ Contribute to AI-enabled features such as content tagging, metadata extraction, summarization, semantic search, and workflow automation.
â€¢ Integrate external AI/LLM services (e.g., OpenAI, AWS Bedrock, or similar) into platform capabilities.
â€¢ Use AI-assisted development tools to improve code quality, automate repetitive tasks, and accelerate delivery (e.g., AI-based code reviews, documentation, and testing support)
â€¢ Partner with product managers and stakeholders to shape product vision and translate business needs into technical solutions.
â€¢ Collaborate across teams and take ownership for delivering high-quality outcomes.
â€¢ Stay current with emerging technologies and advocate for improvements where appropriate.

Requirements
â€¢ A bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field.
â€¢ Three plus years of experience developing commercial quality applications.
â€¢ Experience with web API design and RESTful web services.
â€¢ Strong programming skills in Python, C#.
â€¢ Knowledge of modern front-end technologies is a plus (Vue, React, Angular, Web Components).
â€¢ Working knowledge of messaging technologies (Kafka, AWS SQS/Kinesis) and relational databases (SQL Server, Postgres) technologies.
â€¢ Experience with AWS compute technologies (Lambda, ECS/ECR, EC2, API Gateway, IAM, S3) is a plus
â€¢ Experience with Amazon Neptune, graph databases, and Gremlin for modeling and querying taxonomy hierarchies is a nice-to-have.
â€¢ Experience with search technologies such as Elasticsearch or OpenSearch.
â€¢ Experience with software engineering best practices, including test-driven development, automated unit testing and functional testing, and DevOps practices such as continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD).
â€¢ Knowledge and practical experience with domain modeling and object-oriented design patterns and principles, such as the SOLID principles.
â€¢ Flexible team player who remains organized and productive while managing multiple deliverables.

Compensation and Benefits

At Morningstar we believe people are at their best when they are at their healthiest. Thatâ€™s why we champion your wellness through a wide range of programs that support all stages of your personal and professional life. Here are some examples of the offerings we provide:
â€¢ Financial Health
â€¢ 100% 401k match up to 6% of salary
â€¢ Stock Ownership Potential
â€¢ Company provided life insurance - 1x salary + commission
â€¢ Physical Health
â€¢ Comprehensive health benefits (medical/dental/vision) including potential premium discounts and company-provided HSA contributions (up to $500-$2,000 annually) for specific plans and coverages
â€¢ Additional medical Wellness Incentives - up to $300-$600 annual
â€¢ Company-provided long- and short-term disability insurance
â€¢ Emotional Health
â€¢ Trust-Based Time Off
â€¢ 6-week Paid Sabbatical Program
â€¢ 6-Week Paid Family Caregiving Leave
â€¢ Competitive 8-24 Week Paid Parental Leave
â€¢ Adoption Assistance
â€¢ Leadership Coaching & Formal Mentorship Opportunities
â€¢ Annual Flex Stipend - $1000 annually to cover personal education & well-being expenses
â€¢ Tuition Reimbursement
â€¢ Social Health
â€¢ Charitable Matching Gifts program
â€¢ Dollars for Doers volunteer program
â€¢ Paid volunteering days
â€¢ 15+ Employee Resource & Affinity Groups

Total Cash Compensation Range
$89,625.00 - 152,350.00 USD Annual

Inclusive of annual base salary and target incentive

Morningstar's hybrid work environment gives you the opportunity to collaborate in-person each week as we've found that we're at our best when we're purposely together on a regular basis. In most of our locations, our hybrid work model is four days in-office each week. A range of other benefits are also available to enhance flexibility as needs change. No matter where you are, you'll have tools and resources to engage meaningfully with your global colleagues.

001_MstarInc Morningstar Inc. Legal Entity

title: (USA) Software Engineer III
description:
Position Summary...

What you'll do...Participates in the discovery phase of small to medium-sized projects to come up with high level design by partnering with the product management, project management, business, and user experience teams. Troubleshoots business and production issues by gathering information (for example, issue, impact, criticality, possible root cause); performing root cause analysis to reduce future issues; engaging support teams to assist in the resolution of issues; developing solutions; driving the development of an action plan; performing actions as designated in the plan; interpreting the results to determine further action; and completing online documentation. Manages small to large-sized complex projects by reviewing project requirements; translating requirements into technical solutions; researching and identifying alternative solutions; determining needed solution based on return on investment and value add to the business; gathering requested information (for example, design documents, product requirements, wire frames); writing and developing code; conducting unit testing; communicating status and issues to team members and stakeholders; collaborating with project team and cross functional teams; identifying areas of opportunity; interpreting information and identifying a solution; ensuring solution is sustainable across implementation and use; troubleshooting open issues and bug-fixes; and ensuring on-time delivery and hand-offs. Provides support to the business by responding to user questions, concerns, and issues (for example, technical feasibility, implementation strategies); researching and identifying needed solutions; determining implementation designs; providing guidance regarding implications of new and enhanced systems; identifying short and long term solutions; and directing users to appropriate contacts for issues outside of associate's domain. Assists in providing guidance to small groups of two to three engineers, including offshore associates, for assigned Engineering projects by proving pertinent documents, directions, examples, and timeline. Requirement And Scoping Analysis: Requires knowledge of: Traceability matrix; Risk analysis methodologies; Cost Analysis; Business objectives; Classification of requirements; User stories To understand the Business/Stakeholder/Technical requirements and assist in analyzing the existing solutions to address the needs (in case of agile methodology, for the iteration). Prepare requirement traceability matrix and maintain traceability between business requirements, functional requirements, design and test cases. Contribute to the creation of user stories for component/module/simple requirements ( for example: based on scalability etc.) (For agile methodology). Coding: Requires knowledge of: Coding standards and guidelines; Coding languages (E.g. JavaScript, Python, C# etc.), frameworks(E.g. ActiveX, .Net, Cocoa, Android application framework etc.), tools(E.g. Monday.com, Linx, Embold etc.) and Platforms (E.g. Microsoft Azure, AWS , Apple IOS etc.); Quality, Safety and Security (PCI etc) standards; Emerging tools and technologies; Telemetry. To create/configure minimalistic code for entire component/application and ensure the components are meeting business/technical requirements, non-functional requirements, low-maintainability, high-availability and high-scalability needs. Assist in the selection of appropriate languages (E.g. JavaScript, Python, C# etc.), development standards and tools (E.g. Monday.com, Linx, Embold etc.)for software coding/configuration. Take initiative to learn the fundamentals of different coding languages and frameworks that would be useful for future scope of work. Build scripts for automation of repetitive and routine tasks in CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery), Testing or any other process(as applicable). Implement telemetry features as required independently. Ensure security policy requirements are properly applied to components/application during code development/configuration. Testing: Requires knowledge of: Test case preparation; Test Objectives; Test Strategy; Test types; Test tools (E.g. - Automation - Selenium, Agile - Jira, Mobile - Eggplant etc.); Test Environment; Root cause analysis. To map the customer requirements in to test objectives. Identify and create test cases for the component/module. Execute test cases to test the code and detect errors and defects for the entire component. Execute different types of testing using appropriate testing tools based on the testing needs. Defect Management and Troubleshooting: Requires knowledge of: Defect life-cycle process, defect tracking tools and methodologies; Defect reporting; Regression testing; Root cause analysis; Root cause corrective action. To track and analyze defects for the component/ module and carry out regression testing to fix defects in all instances of code changes. Analyze defects from past projects/solutions to avoid recurrence of similar defects. Troubleshoot performance and availability bottlenecks for the application. DevOps Orientation: Requires knowledge of: Different operating systems; Software maintenance tools and techniques; Application monitoring tools and techniques; Debugging tools; Mock screen; Pseudocodes; Reverse Engineering; Traceability matrix; System performance, security, integration; Data migration and accessibility; Design Methodologies. To conduct complex maintenance procedures for applications independently. Monitor and evaluate the performance of the application by tracking and analyzing appropriate metrics; Perform maintenance (corrective, adaptive, perfective) and re-engineering activities. Analyze application logs, maintenance activity data, performance data and provide analysis; Evaluate change requests to identify those which are valid and feasible. Program Monitoring: Requires knowledge of: Program metrics; Program Reporting, logging tools and processes; Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CICD) To ensure adherence to the project against approved milestones and timelines. Coordinates, completes, and oversees job-related activities and assignments by developing and maintaining relationships with key stakeholders; supporting plans and initiatives to meet customer and business needs; identifying and communicating goals and objectives; building accountability for and measuring progress in achieving results; identifying and addressing improvement opportunities; and demonstrating adaptability and promoting continuous learning. Provides supervision and development opportunities for associates by hiring and training; mentoring; assigning duties; providing recognition; and promoting a belonging mindset in workplace. Ensures compliance with company policies and procedures and supports company mission, values, and standards of ethics and integrity by implementing related action plans; utilizing and supporting the Open Door Policy; and providing direction and guidance on applying these in executing business processes and practices. Agile Methodology, Software Design, Project Management Respect the Individual: Demonstrates and encourages respect for all; builds a high-performing team; seeks, and embraces differences in people, cultures, ideas and experiences; creates a workplace where all associates feel seen, supported and connected through culture of belonging so associates thrive and perform; drives a positive associate and customer/member experience for all; identifies, attracts, and retains the best team members. Respect the Individual: Creates a discipline and focus around developing talent, through feedback, coaching, mentoring, and developmental opportunities; promotes an environment allowing everyone to bring their best selves to work; empowers associates and partners to act in the best interest of the customer/member and company; and regularly recognizes othersâ€™ contributions and accomplishments. Respect the Individual: Builds strong and trusting relationships with team members and business partners; works collaboratively and cross-functionally to achieve objectives; and communicates and listens attentively, with energy and positivity to motivate, influence, and inspire commitment and action. title: Software Engineer, New Grad (Recent 2025 Grads)
description:
Who We Are:

SmithRx is a rapidly growing, venture-backed Health-Tech company. Our mission is to disrupt the expensive and inefficient Pharmacy Benefit Management (PBM) sector by building a next-generation drug acquisition platform driven by cutting edge technology, innovative cost saving tools, and best-in-class customer service. With hundreds of thousands of members onboarded since 2016, SmithRx has a solution that is resonating with clients all across the country.

We pride ourselves for our mission-driven and collaborative culture that inspires our employees to do their best work. We believe that the U.S healthcare system is in need of transformation, and we come to work each day dedicated to making that change a reality. At our core, we are guided by our company values:
â€¢ Integrity: Our purpose guides our actions and gives us confidence in the path ahead. With unwavering honesty and dependability, we embrace the pressure of challenging the old and exemplify ethical leadership to create the new.
â€¢ Courage: We face continuous challenges with grit and resilience. We embrace the discomfort of the unknown by balancing autonomy with empathy, and ownership with vulnerability. We boldly challenge the status quo to keep moving forwardâ€”always.
â€¢ Together: The success of SmithRx reflects the strength of our partnerships and the commitment of our team. Our shared values bind us together and make us one. When one falls, we all fall; when one rises, we all rise.

Job Summary:

The engineering team at SmithRx is developing a next-generation pharmacy benefits management (PBM) platform that is changing how companies administer and manage pharmacy benefits. Our unified technology platform provides real-time, actionable insights that drive cost savings, power clinical services, and result in a brilliant customer experience. A unified technology platform of this caliber does not exist elsewhere in the pharmacy benefit ecosystem to programmatically solve widespread deficiencies. The result is a PBM delivering unmatched service quality and operational efficiencies that exceed all industry standards.

This role is part of the Drug Access team within the Application Engineering organization, which owns and operates our backend data for managing first-party (1P) and third-party (3P) drug data. You will play a key role in the entire engineering lifecycleâ€”from coding and build to testing and maintaining our SmithRx product suite. You will contribute to best practices, coding standards. We need our engineers to be versatile and driven, display leadership and ownership qualities, and be enthusiastic about taking on new challenges across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

What you will do:
â€¢ Full-Stack Development: Focus on our back-end and front-end codebase to develop and maintain SmithRx product features using Golang, GraphQL, SQL, React, JavaScript/TypeScript, Node, and Java.
â€¢ Collaborate: Work with technical leads to understand functional and technical requirements to produce high-quality, scalable software.
â€¢ Learn and Apply Best Practices: Study and apply software development best practices, design patterns, and modern tools across every project.
â€¢ Extend the Platform: Leverage frameworks such as GraphQL, React, and GORM to expand the capabilities of our platform.
â€¢ Cloud Infrastructure: Learn to effectively use AWS technologies at production scale, including Lambda and Fargate, to handle various job types and batch processing.
â€¢ Quality Assurance: Ensure code is fully tested end-to-end, maintains high code coverage, and that all features are thoroughly documented.
â€¢ Production Support: Quickly learn to troubleshoot production issues by performing triage, assessing impact, executing mitigation plans, and performing root cause analysis to prevent recurrence.
â€¢ Culture of Learning: Contribute to a collaborative culture through code reviews and the exploration of new technologies.
â€¢ AI Innovation: Actively seek out and share new AI tools and technologies to improve software delivery speed and quality.

What you will bring to SmithRx:
â€¢ Education: BS in Computer Science or a related field.
â€¢ Experience: Recent college graduate or less than 2 years of professional software engineering experience.
â€¢ Background: Participation in coding competitions or fully released independent projects is a plus.
â€¢ Technical Expertise: Experience with a compiled language such as Go, Java, C#, or C++ (Go experience is a strong plus).
â€¢ Database Fundamentals: Ability to write effective and efficient queries with relational databases (specifically PostgreSQL), including basic schema design.
â€¢ API Design: A solid grasp of the fundamentals of designing and implementing scalable APIs, along with an understanding of design patterns and testing best practices.
â€¢ Cloud & DevOps: A basic understanding of GraphQL APIs, CI/CD pipelines, AWS, Docker, and Kubernetes.
â€¢ AI Proficiency: Experience using GenAI tools to deliver high-quality, production-ready software is a plus; an understanding of the pitfalls and limitations of AI is a must.
â€¢ Soft Skills: A positive, non-dogmatic, team-first attitude with the flexibility to navigate ambiguity.

What SmithRx Offers You:
â€¢ Highly competitive wellness benefits including Medical, Pharmacy, Dental, Vision, and Life Insurance and AD&D Insurance
â€¢ Flexible Spending Benefits
â€¢ 401(k) Retirement Savings Program
â€¢ Short-term and long-term disability
â€¢ Discretionary Paid Time Off
â€¢ Paid Company Holidays
â€¢ Wellness Benefits
â€¢ Commuter Benefits
â€¢ Paid Parental Leave benefits
â€¢ Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
â€¢ Well-stocked kitchen in office locations
â€¢ Professional development and training opportunities

title: Software Engineer Level 2 with Security Clearance
description:
Overview What We're Looking For As a Level 2 Software Engineer at CyberPoint, you will design, develop, and enhance sophisticated software systems that tackle complex technical challenges ranging from large-scale data processing and advanced algorithms to real-time systems and integrated business platforms. Youll take on leadership responsibilities, guiding teams, setting technical direction and ensuring quality while still engaging in hands-on development. When you become a part of CyberPoint you are joining a dynamic, diverse, fast-growing company that welcomes creative thought and ambition. Were committed to creating an environment where each employee can thrive. What Youll Do

â€¢ Analyze user requirements to derive software design and performance specifications.
â€¢ Design, code and modify software to add new features or improve performance.
â€¢ Integrate existing software into new or updated systems and environments.
â€¢ Debug software and resolve defects.
â€¢ Develop and implement algorithms that are complex and include strict performance or timing constraints.
â€¢ Build applications using programming languages such as C, C++, C#, Java and Python.
â€¢ Develop for Windows and UNIX environments, including scripting and automation.
â€¢ Oversee and coordinate software development teams, ensuring adherence to project standards.
â€¢ Perform quality control and reviews of team deliverables.
â€¢ Implement and recommend improvements to documentation and software development processes.
â€¢ Design and implement complex database interfaces and data queries.
â€¢ Lead the development and execution of test procedures.
â€¢ Collaborate with system and hardware engineers to gather requirements and resolve integration challenges.
â€¢ Use DevOps and CI/CD tools such as Artifactory, Docker, Terraform, Ansible, Packer, Jenkins and Bamboo.
â€¢ Coordinate software system installations and verify operational readiness. This position is 100% onsite and requires an active TS/SCI+FSP Security Clearance. Salary Range: $115,000 - $158,000 Qualifications What You'll Need
â€¢ U.S. Citizenship
â€¢ Active TS/SCI with Full-Scope Polygraph
â€¢ Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field. Equivalent work experience may be considered.
â€¢ Minimum fourteen (14) years experience in programs and contracts of similar scope, type and complexity.
â€¢ Expertise in at least one major programming language (C, C++, C#, Java, Python).
â€¢ Strong experience in Windows and UNIX development.
â€¢ Proficiency with DevOps tools and automated CI/CD pipelines.
â€¢ Experience leading and mentoring software development teams.
â€¢ Strong problem-solving skills and ability to deliver under tight performance and resource constraints.
â€¢ Familiarity with large-scale data systems, advanced algorithms and performance optimization. Our Culture Great People, Exceptional Benefits Great people are the foundation of any great company. To attract and retain great people, CyberPoint offers fulfilling work that we like to balance with the rest of life. We accomplish this by offering outstanding benefits that allow each of our employees to live and work well. To learn more, https://www.cyberpointllc.com/benefits.php . Be a part of CyberPoint. Be valued. We are an inclusive community in which all types of diversity are embraced, respected and seen as true value for the company. We are committed to cultivating this community, but we realize there is still more work to do. CyberPoint will continue to evolve into a more inclusive and equitable company and is fully committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action. CyberPoint is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, race, age, religion, physical or mental disability, veterans status or other federal, state and local protected characteristics. As a federal contractor, CyberPoint has established affirmative action programs to ensure non-discrimination and affirmative action in CyberPoints policies and practices for qualified women, minorities, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities. The narrative portion of CyberPoints affirmative action plans are available for inspection at our offices during normal business hours. Employees and applicants interested in inspecting these plans should contact Human Resources by phone 410-779-6700 or by email at for assistance. If you are interested in applying for employment with CyberPoint and need special assistance or an accommodation to apply for a posted position, contact our Human Resources department by email at or by calling 410-779-6700.

title: Software Engineer 2 with Security Clearance
description:

â€¢ Analyze user requirements to derive software design and performance requirements.

â€¢ Modify existing software to correct errors, to adapt to new hardware, or to improve its performance.
â€¢ Design, develop and modify software systems, using scientific analysis and mathematical models to predict and measure outcome and consequences of design.
â€¢ Design or implement complex algorithms requiring adherence to strict timing, system resource, or interface constraints; perform quality control on team products.
â€¢ Implement recommendations for improving documentation and software development process standards.
â€¢ Oversee one or more software development teams and ensure the work is completed in accordance with the constraints of the software development process being used on any particular project.

â€¢ Coordinate software system installation and monitor equipment functioning to ensure operational specifications are met. Required: Current TS/SCI with polygraph. Eight (8) years of experience as a SWE on programs and contracts of similar scope, type, and complexity. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related discipline from an accredited college or university. Four (4) years of additional SWE experience on projects with similar software processes may be substituted for a bachelor's degree. Desired: Three (3) years of experience in a CNO environment. One (1) year of experience coding in Python. Three (3) years of experience with User Interface Web Design and Usability Development. Five (5) years of experience Software Database and Repository Interface Development. Employee Referral Award Eligibility: This requisition is eligible for an employee referral award. ALL eligibility requirements must be met to receive the referral award. The salary associated with this position ($99,000 - $206,000) is commensurate with the selected candidate's qualifications, years of relevant experience, and demonstrated level of expertise. Compensation will be determined based on these factors to ensure alignment with skills, responsibilities, and market standards. Nightwing offers medical, vision and dental insurance coverage in addition to a 401k plan, PTO, Holidays and additional insurances. #NWTBSWE2 At Nightwing, we value collaboration and teamwork. You'll have the opportunity to work alongside talented individuals who are passionate about what they do. Together, we'll leverage our collective expertise to drive innovation, solve complex problems, and deliver exceptional results for our clients. Thank you for considering joining us as we embark on this new journey and shape the future of cybersecurity and intelligence together as part of the Nightwing team. title: Offensive Cyber Engineer
description:
Description

At Cryptic Vector, we are dedicated to mission success. We take the time to understand our customers' needs, delivering products that perform when our nation needs them most. We understand that properly supporting the most unique missions of the United States government requires the nationâ€™s best. Our focus is on creating a culture where the best and brightest want to grow, learn, and stay. If coming up with out-of-the-box solutions is your specialty, then youâ€™ll feel right at home at Cryptic Vector. We are solving the countryâ€™s most unique problems in an environment where problem solvers and hard workers thrive. We've replaced corporate red tape with transparency and servant leadership. Honestly, itâ€™s hard not to love this culture!

We value the individual experiences that our team members add to our culture and capabilities. Please don't hesitate to apply even if you don't meet the exact qualifications! We are interested in varying levels of experience.

Offensive Cyber Engineer

As an Offensive Cyber Engineer, youâ€™ll dive deep into reverse engineering and vulnerability research on software and firmware, turning raw binaries into actionable intelligence and building exploits and capabilities that perform under real-world pressure. You will systematically deconstruct complex code to reveal its inner workings, uncover hidden behaviors, and identify exploitable flaws. Youâ€™ll also design and develop post-exploitation effects and implants that are robust, stealthy, and engineered to resist both forensic scrutiny and active countermeasures.

This is work that demands deep technical fluency, creative problem-solving, and the ability to build solutions that hold up when everything is on the line. If youâ€™re motivated by conquering tough challenges and having your expertise translate into high-impact results, this role is for you!

Responsibilities

â€¢ Reverse Engineering (RE) of software/firmware, Vulnerability Research (VR), exploit development/productization
â€¢ Deconstruct and analyze software/firmware to understand its structure, functionality, and behavior
â€¢ Design/develop post-exploitation effects in software/firmware, which can withstand scrutiny and attack
â€¢ Design/develop secure, reliable, software-based communication solutions
â€¢ Design/develop stealth solutions
â€¢ Employ industry-standard tools such as Ghidra, IDA Pro, Wireshark, and Hex editors (e.g., Hex Workshop) to reverse engineer software components
â€¢ Develop scripts and tools in C, Assembly, Rust, and Python to automate and enhance reverse engineering processes
â€¢ Collaborate with hardware teams to understand and interact with physical devices. This includes connecting probes, using logic analyzers, and decoding signals on hardware
â€¢ Write unit tests, functional tests, and end-to-end tests
â€¢ Prepare detailed reports documenting the findings, methodologies, and potential implications of reverse engineering efforts
â€¢ Work closely with cross-functional teams to provide insights and technical expertise on reverse-engineered software/hardware

Requirements

â€¢ Bachelorâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field
â€¢ Strong programming skills in C, Assembly, and Python
â€¢ Extensive experience with reverse engineering tools such as Ghidra, IDA Pro, and Wireshark
â€¢ Proficiency with x86 architecture, or other modern architecture, and Hex editors
â€¢ Ability to interface with hardware, including connecting probes to traces, using logic analyzers, and decoding hardware signals
â€¢ Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and creatively in analyzing software and hardware components
â€¢ Meticulous attention to detail, especially when dealing with complex codebases and hardware systems
â€¢ Priority will be given to candidates with an active Top Secret (TS) clearance

Preferred Qualifications

â€¢ Experience working with embedded systems or IoT devices
â€¢ Familiarity with other assembly languages beyond x86 (e.g., ARM)
â€¢ Knowledge of network protocols and cybersecurity principles

Benefits & Perks

As an Employee First company, we offer a comprehensive and competitive total rewards package:
â€¢ 100% Company-paid medical insurance for employees
â€¢ 100% Company-paid dental and vision insurance
â€¢ Competitive salary and bonus
â€¢ 25% 401k company contribution
â€¢ Generous PTO, parental leave, bereavement leave, and volunteer time
â€¢ Flexible work hours
â€¢ Tuition reimbursement, training allowance, internal mobility opportunities
â€¢ Free beverages and snacks, Donut Fridays, monthly social events

This role requires use of technical data subject to U.S. Government contract restrictions, therefore this posting is only for U.S. Citizens.

Cryptic Vector is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Responsibilities for this Position:

ROLE AND POSITION OBJECTIVES:
Help make the technologies, products and services that make a difference. Thatâ€™s the opportunity thatâ€™s waiting for you at General Dynamics Mission Systems. We help our nationâ€™s heroes keep our nation safe by creating solutions so advanced they redefine innovation for the world. Itâ€™s an amazing challenge. And itâ€™s waiting for you now.

We are ready to hire a junior C++ Software Engineer to develop software for a next-generation sonar array for future United States Navy submarines, pioneering the use of AI in mission-critical systems. This role will heavily rely on AI-generated software, and your primary responsibility will be to craft effective prompts to produce code. You will then apply your deep engineering expertise to take that AI-generated code and make it function correctly by debugging, refining, and integrating it with other pieces of the system.

As a key member of our team, your talent for blending prompt engineering with hands-on software integration and testing will be front and center. You will be instrumental in transforming AI-generated concepts into robust, fully functional, and tested applications that allow the Navy to carry out high-stakes national security missions.

What youâ€™ll experience:
â€¢ Develop C++ applications within a Linux environment as part of a team to meet system requirements for the Navy.

â€¢ Assist in implementing complex sonar signal processing algorithms.

â€¢ Write code, test, integrate and document software solutions with guidance from senior engineers.

title: Mid-level Software Engineer
company_name: Jtec Industries, Inc. - Material Movement Experts
description:
Position Summary

Global C2 Integration Technologies is looking for a high-performing Mid-Level Software Engineer to design, build, and modernize mission-critical platforms supporting Department of Defense and Federal customers. In this role, you will lead complex feature development end-to-end, influence architectural decisions, mentor junior teammates, and help shape engineering standards across programs. Our work operates in secure, regulated environments where reliability, performance, and security are not "nice-to-haves" - they are mission requirements.

Responsibilities
â€¢ Lead full lifecycle software development including architecture, design reviews, implementation, automated testing, deployment, and sustainment.
â€¢ Design and build secure, resilient, and scalable APIs, microservices, data pipelines, and distributed system components.
â€¢ Own complex features and cross-cutting architectural concerns across systems.
â€¢ Translate mission, security, and regulatory requirements into maintainable, high-performance software solutions.
â€¢ Participate in technical road mapping, modernization efforts, and platform evolution.
â€¢ Contribute to shared frameworks, reusable services, and platform components.
â€¢ Enhance CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure-as-code, container orchestration, and cloud-native runtime environments to enable secure, repeatable delivery.
â€¢ Perform root cause analysis across distributed systems spanning application, infrastructure, and pipeline layers.
â€¢ Establish robust testing and observability practices, including logging, monitoring, metrics, and alerting.
â€¢ Protect system uptime and mission continuity in production environments.
â€¢ Provide technical leadership on engineering initiatives, architecture decisions, and coding standards.
â€¢ Mentor junior engineers through structured feedback and knowledge sharing.
â€¢ Promote disciplined engineering practices and a culture of accountability.
â€¢ Partner with program managers, system engineers, cybersecurity teams, and federal stakeholders to align technical execution with operational needs.
â€¢ Support technical briefings, demonstrations, and solution reviews.
â€¢ Champion secure coding practices aligned to DoD cybersecurity frameworks, including Zero Trust and RMF-driven environments.
â€¢ Contribute to platform hardening, reusable solution libraries, and continuous improvement efforts.
â€¢ Evaluate and apply emerging technologies where they provide measurable mission value.

Requirement Qualifications
â€¢ S. Citizenship with ability to obtain and maintain a DoD Secret clearance (Active Secret preferred).
â€¢ Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline (or equivalent practical experience).
â€¢ Proficiency in one or more of the following: Python, Java, C#, Go, JavaScript/TypeScript.
â€¢ Strong understanding of data structures, algorithms, and distributed systems.
â€¢ Experience building RESTful APIs, microservices, and containerized applications.
â€¢ Experience with AWS, Azure, or GCP (IAM, networking, compute services).
â€¢ Experience with CI/CD pipelines, Git workflows, Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform or similar tooling.

Preferred Qualifications
â€¢ Experience supporting production systems in regulated or compliance-driven environments (e.g., federal, defense, healthcare, or financial systems) is a plus.
â€¢ Familiarity with security frameworks or compliance processes (such as NIST, RMF, FedRAMP, or Zero Trust concepts).
â€¢ Contributions to open-source projects, technical blogs, internal engineering communities, or formal mentorship programs.

WORK ENVIRONMENT: Work environment will have moderate noise when working in an office environment.

title: Software Engineers -DevSecOps (Associate and Experienced)
description:
Job Description

At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. Weâ€™re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate thatâ€™s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.

The Boeing Company is currently seeking Software Engineers -DevSecOps (Associate and Experienced) to work in Berkeley, Missouri.

Weâ€™re seeking a highly talented, motivated, and creative individual to support the existing capabilities of Air Proprietary 1 in the Air Dominance organization. Applicable and appropriate educational/certification credentials from an accredited institution and/or equivalent experience is required.

Position Responsibilities:
â€¢ Assist in the deployment and configuration of technologies and tools used in software development, including build servers, version control systems, CI/CD pipelines and automated testing frameworks
â€¢ Assist in managing and maintain Amazon Web Services (AWS) or Microsoft Azure cloud-based and on premises infrastructures
â€¢ Create and maintain Infrastructure as Code (IaC), Ansible, and other scripts and automation to simplify infrastructure administration and software deployment
â€¢ Assists in setting up development and production environments, deployment of application devices
â€¢ Assists in developing best practices/methodologies for provisioning, platform scaling, configuration management, monitoring and troubleshooting
â€¢ Assists in providing information to delivery teams to establish and achieve service level indicators, service level objectives, service level agreements, key-performance indicators, and error budgets
â€¢ Supports or Manages software development tool administration, maintenance, version upgrades, patch management, and integration between the tools (Jira, Gitlab, Artifactory, Confluence, SonarQube, etc)
â€¢ Provides information in creating and executing process improvement solutions
â€¢ Strives to continuously drive solutions to answer the question â€œHow do we operationally field higher quality end-to-end system software more frequently?
â€¢ Contributes to the deployment and configuration of technologies and tools used in software development, including build servers, version control systems, CI/CD pipelines and automated testing frameworks
â€¢ Implements automation frameworks and tools to streamline development workflows, enhance deployment efficiency, and reduce manual intervention, ensuring consistent and reliable software delivery
â€¢ Develops and maintains metrics and dashboards to monitor system performance and operational efficiency, enabling data-driven decision-making and continuous improvement
â€¢ Actively manages and maintains Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud-based and on premises infrastructures
â€¢ Create and maintain Infrastructure as Code (IaC), Ansible, and other scripts and automation to simplify infrastructure administration and software deployment
â€¢ Establishes and maintains development and production environments, deployment of application devices
â€¢ Develops best practices/methodologies for provisioning, platform scaling, configuration management, monitoring and troubleshooting
â€¢ Provides information to delivery teams to establish and achieve service level indicators, service level objectives, service level agreements, key-performance indicators, and error budgets
â€¢ Mentors and advises junior teammates and development teams on best practices in DevSecOps, providing technical guidance and fostering a culture of knowledge sharing and continuous learning

This position requires the ability to obtain a U.S. Security Clearance for which the U.S. Government requires U.S. Citizenship. An interim and/or final U.S. Secret Clearance Post-Start is required. This position requires ability to obtain program access, for which the U.S. Government requires U.S. Citizenship only.

Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/ Experience):
â€¢ 1-3 years of experience with C++, C#, Java, or Python
â€¢ 1-3 years of experience with Agile Software Development

Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):
â€¢ Bachelor, Master or Doctor of Science degree from an accredited course of study, in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry
â€¢ Experience with Amazon Web Services
â€¢ Experience with Infrastructure as Code
â€¢ Ability to obtain Security+ certification
â€¢ Linux experience

Drug Free Workplace:

Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.

CodeVue Coding Challenge:

To be considered for this position you will be required to complete a technical assessment as part of the selection process. Failure to complete the assessment will remove you from consideration.

Total Rewards & Pay Transparency:

 - Build guardrails, tooling, frameworks, and automation to empower software engineers to ship secure changes and prevent vulnerabilities from reaching the main branch.

 - Design and build scalable frontend applications and components.


QUALIFICATIONS

 - Minimum 1+ years of experience in a software engineering role. This role requires software development experience.

 - Experience with web application and API development in production environments. At Zip, our stack includes Python, Typescript, React, and GraphQL.

 - Experience in enterprise SaaS, fintech, software security best practices, and compliance frameworks is a bonus, but not required.

description:
The simple task of buying software, services, or tools at work has become hopelessly complicated at even the most innovative companies in the world. Today, enterprises spend $120T+ per year globally (>30 times larger than annual consumer e-commerce spend) and rely on vendors more than ever before to run their businesses.

Our cofounders started Zip in 2020 to address this seemingly intractable problem with a purpose-built procurement platform that provides a simple, consumer-grade user experience. Within the last 4 years, Zip has created a new category and developed the leading solution in this $50B+ TAM space. Today, the worldâ€™s leading companies like OpenAI, Snowflake, Anthropic, Coinbase, and Prudential rely on Zip to manage billions of dollars in spend.

We have a world-class team coming from category-defining companies like Airbnb, Meta, Stripe, Salesforce, Apple, and Google. With a $2.2 billion valuation and $370 million in funding from Y Combinator, Tiger Global, BOND, DST Global, and CRV, weâ€™re focused on developing cutting-edge technology, expanding into new global markets, andâ€”above allâ€“driving incredible value for our customers. Join us!

Your Role

We are seeking a Strategic Finance Associate to join our growing Strategic Finance team, with a focus on Product finance. In this role, you will work closely with Product, Engineering, and GTM leaders to shape the financial strategy of our business. You will build and maintain financial models, develop KPI frameworks, and deliver insights that influence product investments and growth priorities.

This is a high-visibility, high-impact role where youâ€™ll play a critical part in connecting product strategy with financial outcomes, supporting long-range planning, and influencing decisions at the executive and board level as Zip continues to scale.

What youâ€™ll do

 - Design and own core financial models that support our annual plan, long-range forecast, and multi-product growth strategy

 - Partner with Product, GTM, and Operations leaders to set topline targets, evaluate roadmap investments, and align on strategic priorities across the business

 - Build and maintain KPI frameworks that track product performance and sales efficiency, creating a holistic view of business performance to guide resource allocation decisions

 - Support executive decision-making by preparing high-quality board materials, investor updates, and leadership presentations

 - Drive company-wide forecasting and reporting processes across revenue, expenses, headcount, cash flow, and retention metrics

What youâ€™ll need

 - 2+ years of private equity, investment banking, consulting, or similar experience

 - Experience in strategic finance at a high-growth technology company is a plus

 - Familiarity with technology / SaaS business models

 - Excellent financial modeling and quantitative skills

 - Extreme attention to detail and a high regard for precision

 - Strong written and verbal communication

 - Ownership mindset with the ability to collaborate across diverse teams and stakeholders

The salary range for this role is $120,000-$160,000. The salary for this position is determined based on a variety of job-related factors that may include location, relevant experience, education, or particular skills and expertise.

You'll collaborate closely with a highly skilled, cross-functional team that values thoughtful design, fast iteration, and clean, maintainable code.
